original: tshul khrims dang ldan par gyur cing sems pa gsal ba'i snying dang ldan pa gang gis rgyal pos gsad par bya bar btson ra'i nang du bcug pa las nong rdzas thams cad phul nas /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan par gyur cing sems pa gsal ba'i snying dang ldan pa gang gis rgyal pos gsad par bya bar btson ra'i nang du bcug pa las nong rdzas thams cad phul nas /
translated: “If someone who is disciplined and has a clear and compassionate heart were to free someone who was imprisoned by the king and sentenced to death, and give away all his possessions,

original: de thar bar byas sam; de bzhin du rgyal po'i bu'am /🔽de dang mthun pa dag la phul nas de thar par byas la /
analyzed: de thar bar byas sam; de bzhin du rgyal po'i bu'am / de dang mthun pa dag la phul nas de thar par byas la /
translated: or if he were to free the king’s son🔽or someone similar to him, and give away all his possessions,

original: de las nor rdzas sna 'ga' yang len par mi byed de /
analyzed: de las nor rdzas sna 'ga' yang len par mi byed de /
translated: and not take anything back from him,

original: snying rjes brlan pa'i snying gis sems can rnams la phan pa kho na byed cing legs par byas na /
analyzed: snying rjes brlan pa'i snying gis sems can rnams la phan pa kho na byed cing legs par byas na /
translated: and if he were to benefit beings with a heart moistened by compassion, and do so well,

original: de lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten rtag tu dga' ba'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten rtag tu dga' ba'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then, upon separating from his body, he will go to the joyful higher realms and be born among the gods in the world of the ever-joyous gods.

original: der skyes nas kyang lha de rnams ngo bo nyid kyis yid rab tu dga' ba yin la /
analyzed: der skyes nas kyang lha de rnams ngo bo nyid kyis yid rab tu dga' ba yin la /
translated: “Once born there, the gods will naturally be overjoyed,

original: de dag bas kyang de brgya 'gyur du yid rab tu dga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag bas kyang de brgya 'gyur du yid rab tu dga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: and their joy will be a hundred times greater than that of the gods of the other realms.

original: las de dang rgyu mthun par 'bras bu 'brel pas rgyu dang mthun par 'bras bu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: las de dang rgyu mthun par 'bras bu 'brel pas rgyu dang mthun par 'bras bu 'byung ngo //
translated: In accordance with the cause, the effect will be related to it. The effect will be in accordance with the cause.

original: lha'i 'jig rten der skyes pa de lha mo'i tshogs mang pos ni yongs su bskor /
analyzed: lha'i 'jig rten der skyes pa de lha mo'i tshogs mang pos ni yongs su bskor /
translated: “ ‘When one is born in the world of the gods, one will be surrounded by many groups of goddesses.

original: glu dbyangs dang / bro gar dang / bzhad gad @116b dang / rtsed mo dang / dga' mgur spyod pa'i lha mo rnams kyis ni mtha' 'khor te /
analyzed: glu dbyangs dang / bro gar dang / bzhad gad @116b dang / rtsed mo dang / dga' mgur spyod pa'i lha mo rnams kyis ni mtha' 'khor te /
translated: One will be surrounded by goddesses who sing, dance, laugh, play, and enjoy themselves.

original: nye bar spyod cing ri rab dang / ri dang / ri phug dang / ri khrod rnams su ni rgyu /
analyzed: nye bar spyod cing ri rab dang / ri dang / ri phug dang / ri khrod rnams su ni rgyu /
translated: One will roam the mountains, the mountain peaks, the mountain caves, and the mountain slopes.

original: de bee d'urya'i rdo leb bzang po reg na shin tu bde ba rnams kyi steng na rang dgar ni spyod /
analyzed: de bee d'urya'i rdo leb bzang po reg na shin tu bde ba rnams kyi steng na rang dgar ni spyod /
translated: One will enjoy oneself on the excellent slabs of beryl that are so pleasant to the touch.

original: chu bo dang / 'bab chu dang / lteng ka dang / tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal rnams su shin tu bde ba dang ldan pa dag dga' bar byed /
analyzed: chu bo dang / 'bab chu dang / lteng ka dang / tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal rnams su shin tu bde ba dang ldan pa dag dga' bar byed /
translated: One will enjoy oneself in the rivers, waterfalls, ponds, forests, and parks.

original: bde ba de'i khyad par ni 'khor los bsgyur ba'i bde bas 'bum gyi char yang mi phod do //
analyzed: bde ba de'i khyad par ni 'khor los bsgyur ba'i bde bas 'bum gyi char yang mi phod do //
translated: The particular pleasures of such a god cannot be compared to even a hundred thousandth of the pleasures of a universal monarch.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ris mthun pa de dang / sha dang / rus pa dang / chu ser dang bral ba de'i phyir bde'o //
analyzed: ris mthun pa de dang / sha dang / rus pa dang / chu ser dang bral ba de'i phyir bde'o //
translated: It is happy because it is free from the flesh, bones, and lymph of that body of the same type.

original: lha'i rin po che'i phreng ba dang / gos du ma gyon pa me tog brgyus pa dang / bgo ba sna tshogs kyis lus brgyan pa de /
analyzed: lha'i rin po che'i phreng ba dang / gos du ma gyon pa me tog brgyus pa dang / bgo ba sna tshogs kyis lus brgyan pa de /
translated: It is adorned with the bodies of gods, wearing many jeweled necklaces and garments, and with various flowers and clothes.

original: ri rab kyi drung dag na rgyu bar byed de /
analyzed: ri rab kyi drung dag na rgyu bar byed de /
translated: It moves around near Mount Meru.

original: gal te gser gyi ri zom la 'dzegs na gser de'i mthus de gser lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gser gyi ri zom la 'dzegs na gser de'i mthus de gser lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: If it climbs a golden peak, by the power of that gold, it becomes like gold.

original: gal te beed'urya'i zom la 'dzegs na bee d'urya'i mthus bee d'urya'i mdog lta bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te beed'urya'i zom la 'dzegs na bee d'urya'i mthus bee d'urya'i mdog lta bur 'gyur te /
translated: If it climbs a beryl peak, by the power of the beryl, it becomes the color of beryl.

original: bdag nyid mtsho'i nang du zhugs pa ltar gyur kyang 'dam rdzab kyis gos pa lta bur ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid mtsho'i nang du zhugs pa ltar gyur kyang 'dam rdzab kyis gos pa lta bur ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though it enters the water, it is not covered with mud.

original: gal te shel gyi ri zom la 'dzegs na shel gyi 'od des de zla ba gnyis pa lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te shel gyi ri zom la 'dzegs na shel gyi 'od des de zla ba gnyis pa lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: If it climbs a crystal peak, by the light of the crystal, it becomes like a second moon.

original: gal te dngul gyi ri zom la 'dzegs na dngul de'i mthus de'i yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad kha ba dang / me tog ku mu de ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te dngul gyi ri zom la 'dzegs na dngul de'i mthus de'i yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad kha ba dang / me tog ku mu de ltar 'gyur te /
translated: If they climb a mountain of silver, by the power of the silver, all their limbs and minor limbs will become white and like jasmine flowers.

original: de ltar lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba de /🔽sil snyan @117a *//
analyzed: de ltar lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba de / sil snyan @117a *//
translated: Surrounded by a troupe of goddesses,🔽they will enjoy themselves

original: yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal rnams su dga' bar byed /
analyzed: yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal rnams su dga' bar byed /
translated: in the forests and parks endowed with the five types of musical instruments.

original: yongs su spyod par byed cing /
analyzed: yongs su spyod par byed cing /
translated: They will experience

original: lha'i bde ba dpe med pa dag myong bar byed do //🔽de ltar de rnam par spyod pa na shing ljon pa du mas mjes par byas pa /
analyzed: lha'i bde ba dpe med pa dag myong bar byed do // de ltar de rnam par spyod pa na shing ljon pa du mas mjes par byas pa /
translated: divine pleasures that are beyond compare.🔽As they enjoy themselves in this way, they will see from a distance a forest called Delightful Divine Pleasures, which is beautified by many trees.

original: lha'i nyams dga' bar byed pa'i tshal zhes bya ba zhig rgyang ring po nas mthong ba dang / der lha de dag dzambu'i chu bo'i gser gyi shing rta la zhon nas 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: lha'i nyams dga' bar byed pa'i tshal zhes bya ba zhig rgyang ring po nas mthong ba dang / der lha de dag dzambu'i chu bo'i gser gyi shing rta la zhon nas 'gro bar byed do //
translated: The gods will travel there riding in chariots made of the gold of the Jambū River.

original: tshal de'ang bya rnam pa sna tshogs sgra 'byin cing tshal gyi lcug ma gzhon nu 'phyang ba dag tu shing rtas phyin pa dang / bya lha'i skad du rtse ba zhes bya ba lha rnams dang smra ba mthun pa dag lha de'i dge ba'i las kyi mthus bskul ba dang /🔽'di ltar tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
analyzed: tshal de'ang bya rnam pa sna tshogs sgra 'byin cing tshal gyi lcug ma gzhon nu 'phyang ba dag tu shing rtas phyin pa dang / bya lha'i skad du rtse ba zhes bya ba lha rnams dang smra ba mthun pa dag lha de'i dge ba'i las kyi mthus bskul ba dang / 'di ltar tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
translated: In this forest, various birds sing and the young shoots of the trees hang down. As the chariot moves through the forest, the birds known as playful divine voices, which are able to speak the language of the gods, will, by the power of the gods’ virtuous actions, sing the following verses:

original: dga' bar byed pa'i las rnams dag /
analyzed: dga' bar byed pa'i las rnams dag /
translated: “ ‘The actions that bring joy

original: skyes bu gang zhig 'dir byed pa //
analyzed: skyes bu gang zhig 'dir byed pa //
translated: Are the ones that people here should do.

original: de yi las kyi rnam smin na //
analyzed: de yi las kyi rnam smin na //
translated: The ripening of such actions

original: legs par yongs su smin par 'gyur //
analyzed: legs par yongs su smin par 'gyur //
translated: Will be a perfect ripening.

original: bde ba thob pa'i lha de dag /
analyzed: bde ba thob pa'i lha de dag /
translated: “ ‘The gods who have attained happiness

original: bag med pa la ma bstan na //
analyzed: bag med pa la ma bstan na //
translated: Are not taught to be careless.

original: de ni bde las bde thob cing //
analyzed: de ni bde las bde thob cing //
translated: They will attain happiness from happiness

original: mya ngan 'das pa'i rjes su 'gro /
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa'i rjes su 'gro /
translated: And will follow the path to the transcendence of suffering.

original: bde ba'i mtha' de zad 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: bde ba'i mtha' de zad 'gyur zhing //
translated: “ ‘The end of happiness will be exhausted,

original: 'di la rtag dang ther zug med //🔽de thob gzhal med khang rnams la //
analyzed: 'di la rtag dang ther zug med // de thob gzhal med khang rnams la //
translated: And this is neither permanent nor stable.🔽The supreme beings should not be attached

original: skyes bu mchog rnams chags ma byed //
analyzed: skyes bu mchog rnams chags ma byed //
translated: To the palaces that they have attained.

original: bde mtha' rtag tu lhung 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: bde mtha' rtag tu lhung 'gyur zhing //
translated: The end of happiness is always falling,

original: bde la rtag pa nyid med de //
analyzed: bde la rtag pa nyid med de //
translated: And happiness is not permanent.

original: rgyu de thams cad rig nas su //
analyzed: rgyu de thams cad rig nas su //
translated: Knowing all these causes,

original: yid la nges par legs par byos //
analyzed: yid la nges par legs par byos //
translated: Be sure to do what is good.

original: bsags pa @117b thams cad tha mar zad //
analyzed: bsags pa @117b thams cad tha mar zad //
translated: All that is accumulated will eventually be exhausted,

original: mtho ba'i mthar ni tha mar rnyil //
analyzed: mtho ba'i mthar ni tha mar rnyil //
translated: The end of what is high is falling down,

original: 'du ba'i mtha' ni tha mar 'bral //
analyzed: 'du ba'i mtha' ni tha mar 'bral //
translated: The end of coming together is separation,

original: 'tsho ba'i mtha' ni tha mar 'chi //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i mtha' ni tha mar 'chi //
translated: And the end of life is death.

original: skyes pa rtag tu 'chi 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: skyes pa rtag tu 'chi 'gyur zhing //
translated: All that is born will certainly die,🔽And it is not permanent.

original: de la rtag pa nyid med de; ;khams gsum dag tu sngon byung zhe'am //
analyzed: de la rtag pa nyid med de; ;khams gsum dag tu sngon byung zhe'am //
translated: It is said that in the three realms

original: phyi nas 'byung ba nyid med do //
analyzed: phyi nas 'byung ba nyid med do //
translated: There is nothing that will come in the future.🔽Just as the rising and setting of the sun

original: ji ltar nyi ma 'char ba dang // nub par 'gyur ba rab tu mngon //
analyzed: ji ltar nyi ma 'char ba dang // nub par 'gyur ba rab tu mngon //
translated: Is clearly seen,

original: de ltar skyes pa thams cad kyi //
analyzed: de ltar skyes pa thams cad kyi //
translated: So it is for all that is born:

original: tha mar 'chi ba gnas pa yin //
analyzed: tha mar 'chi ba gnas pa yin //
translated: In the end, it will die.

original: chos rnams kyi ni ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ni ngo bo nyid //
translated: Knowing the nature of phenomena

original: skye dang 'jig pa 'di shes nas //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa 'di shes nas //
translated: To arise and perish in this way,

original: bag med yid la ma byed cig /
analyzed: bag med yid la ma byed cig /
translated: Do not be careless and distracted.

original: bag med dug gi mchog yin no //
analyzed: bag med dug gi mchog yin no //
translated: Carelessness is the supreme poison.

original: bag yod 'chi med gnas yin la //
analyzed: bag yod 'chi med gnas yin la //
translated: Carefulness is the abode of immortality.

original: bag med 'chi ba'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: bag med 'chi ba'i gnas yin no //
translated: Carelessness is the abode of death.

original: bag yod 'chi bar mi 'gyur la //
analyzed: bag yod 'chi bar mi 'gyur la //
translated: The careful do not die.

original: bag med rnams ni rtag tu 'chi //
analyzed: bag med rnams ni rtag tu 'chi //
translated: The careless always die.

original: ji ltar dug dang ji ltar me //
analyzed: ji ltar dug dang ji ltar me //
translated: Like poison, like fire,

original: srog chags bag med de bzhin te //
analyzed: srog chags bag med de bzhin te //
translated: so is carelessness for living beings.

original: bag med myos pa'i sems can rnams //
analyzed: bag med myos pa'i sems can rnams //
translated: Those beings who are intoxicated by carelessness

original: sdug las sdug bsngal de 'gro'o //🔽rtag tu bag yod mi rnams ni //
analyzed: sdug las sdug bsngal de 'gro'o // rtag tu bag yod mi rnams ni //
translated: go from suffering to suffering.🔽The careful ones among humans

original: 'jig rten kun gyis phyag byas shing //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun gyis phyag byas shing //
translated: are always honored by the whole world.

original: gang na bag med mi gnas pa //
analyzed: gang na bag med mi gnas pa //
translated: Where there is no carelessness

original: zhi ba mchog tu 'gro bar byed //
analyzed: zhi ba mchog tu 'gro bar byed //
translated: one goes to the highest peace.

original: de kun mtha' ni zad 'gyur te //
analyzed: de kun mtha' ni zad 'gyur te //
translated: All of that ends in exhaustion.

original: rmongs pa gang zhig mi rig pa //
analyzed: rmongs pa gang zhig mi rig pa //
translated: The deluded one who does not understand

original: de ni phyi nas 'chi 'gyur te //
analyzed: de ni phyi nas 'chi 'gyur te //
translated: will die later

original: ma byas don med gdung bar byed //
analyzed: ma byas don med gdung bar byed //
translated: and will be tormented without purpose.

original: rtag tu bdag nyid dga' 'dod na //
analyzed: rtag tu bdag nyid dga' 'dod na //
translated: If you always want to be happy,

original: 'chi ba'i bar du dge ba byos //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i bar du dge ba byos //
translated: do good until the end of death.🔽The wise advise:

original: chos spyod bde ba yin no zhes //🔽mkhas pa rnams kyis gdams pa yin //🔽rgyu yi de nyid rnam ston pa //
analyzed: chos spyod bde ba yin no zhes // mkhas pa rnams kyis gdams pa yin // rgyu yi de nyid rnam ston pa //
translated: “Dharma practice is happiness.”🔽The buddhas have taught the truth of the cause

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis 'khor ba kun //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis 'khor ba kun //
translated: of all of saṃsāra

original: rtag tu mi @118a *//🔽rtag mi brtan la //
analyzed: rtag tu mi @118a *// rtag mi brtan la //
translated: “ ‘Impermanent, unstable,🔽And always changing.

original: 'gyur zhing tsha bar rtag tu gsungs //
analyzed: 'gyur zhing tsha bar rtag tu gsungs //
translated: They are said to be hot. ’

original: de nas lha des bya de rnams kyi tshig thos nas yang dag par bsams te yid la yang dga' ba bskyed pa dang / sngon gyi tshe'i 'bras bu dran nas phud tsam zhig bag med pa la ma zhugs so //
analyzed: de nas lha des bya de rnams kyi tshig thos nas yang dag par bsams te yid la yang dga' ba bskyed pa dang / sngon gyi tshe'i 'bras bu dran nas phud tsam zhig bag med pa la ma zhugs so //
translated: “When the god hears the birds’ words, he will reflect on them and feel joy in his mind. Remembering the fruits of his past lives, he will not fall into carelessness for a short while.

original: mos pa'i srab skyogs kyis yid de 'dzin par byed de /🔽gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dal /
analyzed: mos pa'i srab skyogs kyis yid de 'dzin par byed de / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dal /
translated: He will rein in his mind with the reins of interest.🔽He will not be careless about the delightful forms, sounds, smells, tastes,

original: rig bya yid du 'ong ba rnams la bag med pa ma skyes so //
analyzed: rig bya yid du 'ong ba rnams la bag med pa ma skyes so //
translated: And textures that he experiences.

original: de nas yang yid mi brtan pa de lha'i bde ba'i dbang du gyur te ji srid du 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba de ma zad kyi bar du /
analyzed: de nas yang yid mi brtan pa de lha'i bde ba'i dbang du gyur te ji srid du 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba de ma zad kyi bar du /
translated: “However, his unstable mind will again be carried away by divine pleasures. Until his desirable, attractive, and delightful enjoyments are exhausted,

original: de yul sdug pa de rnams la spyod par byed de /
analyzed: de yul sdug pa de rnams la spyod par byed de /
translated: he will continue to enjoy those delightful objects.

original: de phyis lha yul de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de phyis lha yul de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
translated: “When he later dies and leaves his divine world,

original: shi nas kyang gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i nang du ma skyes la /
analyzed: shi nas kyang gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i nang du ma skyes la /
translated: After death, if they do not take birth as a hell being, a hungry ghost, or an animal due to karmic actions to be experienced in other lives,

original: mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na /
analyzed: mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na /
translated: they may be born with the general lot in life of a human.

original: de las de dang rgyu mthun par nam yang bcings par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de las de dang rgyu mthun par nam yang bcings par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: In that case, they will, in accordance with their causal actions, never be bound by others.

original: rtag tu bde ba dang ldan pa nyam nga ba rnams las thar bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo //🔽de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
analyzed: rtag tu bde ba dang ldan pa nyam nga ba rnams las thar bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo // de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
translated: They will always be happy and free from danger.

original: lha lag na yol go thogs pa rnams kyi gnas la rtog par byed de /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: lha lag na yol go thogs pa rnams kyi gnas la rtog par byed de / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: “Next, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will examine the realm of the vessel-bearer gods.

original: lha lag na yol go thogs pa rnams kyi gnas dri la chags pa zhes bya ba ji @118b ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: lha lag na yol go thogs pa rnams kyi gnas dri la chags pa zhes bya ba ji @118b ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will notice a realm of the vessel-bearer gods known as Attached to Smell.

original: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
analyzed: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
translated: Wondering what karmic actions may cause beings to take birth there, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: Through the knowledge derived from hearing, he will discern that🔽

original: skyes bu tshul khrims dang ldan pa sems pas yongs su bsgoms pa'i snying dang / yid shin tu dang ba /
analyzed: skyes bu tshul khrims dang ldan pa sems pas yongs su bsgoms pa'i snying dang / yid shin tu dang ba /
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing, he will then notice that when a person of ethical discipline has cultivated his mind with thoughts of generosity, his heart and mind will become very clear and pure.

original: sems rnyog pa med par gyur pa /🔽gzhan la gnod pa med pa gang gis sangs rgyas sam /
analyzed: sems rnyog pa med par gyur pa / gzhan la gnod pa med pa gang gis sangs rgyas sam /
translated: His mind will be free from turbidity,🔽and he will not harm others.

original: chos sam / dge 'dun la zhing chen por shes nas /
analyzed: chos sam / dge 'dun la zhing chen por shes nas /
translated: If he understands that the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha are great fields of merit,

original: gos shin tu dri zhim pa rnams kyis mchod pa byas la legs par byas so snyam du'ang sems na /
analyzed: gos shin tu dri zhim pa rnams kyis mchod pa byas la legs par byas so snyam du'ang sems na /
translated: and if he makes offerings to them with very fragrant clothes, thinking, “This is well done,”

original: de lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten dri la chags pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten dri la chags pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then, upon separating from his body, he will go to the joyful higher realms and be born among the gods in Fragrance-Delighting.

original: der skyes nas kyang shin tu bde ba dang / rang gi 'od dang ldan pa dang / sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pas yid rab tu dga' zhing dga' mgur spyod pa de dus ring mo zhig 'das so //

original: dbang po lnga yul lnga dag la spyod pa'ang bde ba la gnas pa des tshim mi myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po lnga yul lnga dag la spyod pa'ang bde ba la gnas pa des tshim mi myong bar 'gyur ro //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: sred pa ji lta bu dag la spyod pa de yul gang gis kyang tshim par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because those who experience craving will not be satisfied by any object.

original: de ltar ri dang / skyed mos tshal dang / chu bo dang / gzhal med khang dang / lteng ka dang / chu dngo rnam pa sna tshogs dang / rin po che sna tshogs dang / rin po che sna bdun gyis mdzes par byas pa /

translated: In this way, the gods and their companions enjoy themselves in various ways in the mountains, parks, rivers, palaces, ponds, streams, various jewels, and the seven precious substances.

analyzed: bya rnam pa sna tshogs sgra snyan pa 'byin cing 'don pa rnams su lha de grogs dang lhan cig bde ba du mar gnas shing bee d'urya'i tshal gyi grib mas mdzes par byas pa dag na bya rnam pa sna tshogs sgra 'byin cing 'don pa'i tshal dang /
translated: In the forests and parks, the gods enjoy themselves, frolicking and reveling in the beautiful shade of the beryl forests, where various birds sing.

original: nye ba'i tshal rnams na dga' bar byed /🔽rtse bar byed; mgu bar byed /
analyzed: nye ba'i tshal rnams na dga' bar byed / rtse bar byed; mgu bar byed /
translated: They enjoy themselves,

original: dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
translated: play, delight, and indulge in pleasures.

original: bee d'urya dang / gser dang / dngul dang / byu ru'i ri rab kyi zom la rang dgar 'khod pa /🔽kha cig ni nyi ma ltar gzi che /
analyzed: bee d'urya dang / gser dang / dngul dang / byu ru'i ri rab kyi zom la rang dgar 'khod pa / kha cig ni nyi ma ltar gzi che /
translated: They are free to sit on the peaks of the mountains of beryl, gold, silver, and coral.🔽Some are as radiant as the sun,

original: kha cig ni zla ba ltar mdangs gsal /
analyzed: kha cig ni zla ba ltar mdangs gsal /
translated: and some are as luminous as the moon.

original: kha cig ni gzugs dpe med pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: kha cig ni gzugs dpe med pa dang ldan te /

analyzed: ji ltar legs par byas pa'i las de rnams kyis lus mngon par bsgrubs pa de ltar lha yul du'ang rnam par mdzes pa yin no // rgyu rkyen dang mthun par spyod pa de ji srid du 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba byas shing bsags pa'i las de zad par ma gyur pa de srid du lha'i @122a *// 'jig rten de ni sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pas dga' bar byed / rtse bar byed /
translated: In accordance with their virtuous actions, their bodies are also beautiful in the divine realms.

original: dga' mgur spyod par byed do //🔽de phyis lha'i 'jig rten de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /🔽shi nas kyang gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i nang du ma skyes la /
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed do // de phyis lha'i 'jig rten de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te / shi nas kyang gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i nang du ma skyes la /
translated: “In this way, they will enjoy themselves, frolic, and celebrate in the divine worlds, accompanied by the music of the five types of instruments, until finally their completed and accumulated acts with desirable, attractive, and delightful consequences have been exhausted.

original: mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na /
analyzed: mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na /
translated: “When they later die and leave their divine world, they will, if they have not taken birth among hell beings, starving spirits, or animals due to karmic actions to be experienced in other lives, be born with the general lot in life of a human.

analyzed: de las de dang rgyu mthun par shin tu nyams dga' ba'i yul lo legs shing bde bar skye la /
translated: In accordance with their causal actions, they will be born in a very pleasant land with excellent harvests and happiness.

original: shin tu 'byor ba dang ldan zhing mchog tu bde bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo //🔽de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
analyzed: shin tu 'byor ba dang ldan zhing mchog tu bde bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo // de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /

original: lha rtag tu myos gnas kyi gnas la rtog par byed de /🔽de thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas /
analyzed: lha rtag tu myos gnas kyi gnas la rtog par byed de / de thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas /
translated: “Next, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will examine the realm of the constantly intoxicated gods.

original: lha rtag tu myos gnas rnams kyi gnas autpa la mdog ces bya ba ji ltar gnas pa mthong ngo //🔽der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /

translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then perceive a realm of the constantly intoxicated gods known as Color of the Blue Lotus.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: Wondering what karmic actions may cause beings to be born there, he will examine this matter with knowledge derived from hearing.

original: chos dang ldan zhing chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa /
analyzed: chos dang ldan zhing chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa /
translated: He will then notice that some people who are righteous and follow the Dharma may, for instance, give a blue lotus to a stūpa of the Tathāgata.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa gang gis 'di ltar me tog autpa la bskyed pa 'dis sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun rnams kyi longs spyod bya'o snyam du bsams nas bskyed la /

original: de'ang 'bul bar byed cing de sems la dga' bar yang 'dzin na /
analyzed: de'ang 'bul bar byed cing de sems la dga' bar yang 'dzin na /
translated: and then offer it, and if they were to keep that in mind with joy,

analyzed: de @122b lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten autpa la'i mdog gi lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //

original: der skyes nas kyang lha yul du rtse ba'i skye bo dang / dga' mgur spyad pa de dag yang rtse ba dang / dga' ba dang / steg pa dang / 'jo ba dang / rol mo'i sgra dang / glu dbyangs dang / bro gar byed pa dang ni ldan /
analyzed: der skyes nas kyang lha yul du rtse ba'i skye bo dang / dga' mgur spyad pa de dag yang rtse ba dang / dga' ba dang / steg pa dang / 'jo ba dang / rol mo'i sgra dang / glu dbyangs dang / bro gar byed pa dang ni ldan /
translated: “Once born there, they will enjoy themselves in the divine realm, and their companions will also enjoy themselves, reveling, delighting, and frolicking, making music, singing, and dancing.

original: bde ba du ma la ni gnas /
analyzed: bde ba du ma la ni gnas /
translated: They will experience numerous pleasures.

original: tshal nas tshal dang / bee d'urya'i tshal gyi grib ma mdzes pa dang / gser btso ma dang / byu ru lta bu'i sa gzhi bde ba mthon dma' ran pa rnams su ni rgyu /
analyzed: tshal nas tshal dang / bee d'urya'i tshal gyi grib ma mdzes pa dang / gser btso ma dang / byu ru lta bu'i sa gzhi bde ba mthon dma' ran pa rnams su ni rgyu /

original: lha mo'i tshogs du mas ni yongs su bskor /
analyzed: lha mo'i tshogs du mas ni yongs su bskor /
translated: They are surrounded by many groups of goddesses.

original: kha zas zhim po ni za /
analyzed: kha zas zhim po ni za /

analyzed: ci dga' mgur 'dod pa thams cad bsam pa tsam gyis ni 'grub /
translated: All their wishes are fulfilled by merely thinking of them.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi ri du ma la ni gnas /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi ri du ma la ni gnas /

original: bde ba las mchog tu bde ba ni thob /
analyzed: bde ba las mchog tu bde ba ni thob /

original: dbang po lnga yul lnga la chags shing dga' ba ni nyin gcig bzhin nyams dga' bar byed /
analyzed: dbang po lnga yul lnga la chags shing dga' ba ni nyin gcig bzhin nyams dga' bar byed /

analyzed: autpa la sngon po dang / bee d'urya'i mdog lta bu'i lus ni autpa la'i tshal nas autpa la'i tshal du rgyu /

original: de nas de ltar @123a *//

translated: “ ‘In this way,

analyzed: de phyis lha'i 'jig rten de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
translated: When he later dies and leaves the god realm,

analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la'ang sems dad pa dang ldan par gyur na /

analyzed: der skyes nas kyang legs par byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu la spyod pa de /

translated: In this regard,

analyzed: rgyan dang / rin po che dang / 'od sna tshogs kyis ni lus brgyan /

analyzed: dga' ya yar rab tu dga' zhing rtse bar ni gnas /

analyzed: de phyis lha'i 'jig rten de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /

translated: If, after dying, they do not take birth among hell beings, starving spirits, or animals due to karmic actions to be experienced in other lives,

translated: and if they are born with the general lot in life of a human,

translated: Wondering what karmic actions may cause beings to be born there, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing.

analyzed: gnyis sam / gsum mam / bzhi lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: He will then notice how some people who engage in wholesome physical and verbal actions, who are endowed with discipline, who wish to benefit others, who are gentle, compassionate, and naturally kind, who are honest and without deceit, and who do not harm others, may give to mendicants and brahmins in the four directions, who are afflicted and without protection, for one, two, three, or even four days.

translated: If they give in this way, gradually increasing the scope of their generosity, when they later separate from their bodies, they will go to the joyful higher realms and be born among the gods in the perpetually intoxicated realm of the gods who dwell in forests.

analyzed: der skyes nas kyang mtho ris kyi skyed mos tshal na bde bar gnas pa de gser gyi dril bu g-yer kha'i dra bas bres pa /

analyzed: 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba'i yul la chags pa dag dga' mgur spyod par byed do //

analyzed: me tog manda ra ba'i phreng bas ni mgo brgyan /

analyzed: padma'i tshal gyi gsab gseb na ni gnas /

analyzed: gser dang / bee d'urya dang / shel dang / dngul gyi ri dag la ni 'dzeg /
translated: They will climb golden, beryl, crystal, and silver mountains,

original: bung ba sgra skad snyan pa 'byin pa'i padma'i tshal rnams kyi nang na rnam par rgyu bar ni byed /
analyzed: bung ba sgra skad snyan pa 'byin pa'i padma'i tshal rnams kyi nang na rnam par rgyu bar ni byed /
translated: and they will roam among the lotus groves where the sweet sounds of bees can be heard.

original: lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor cing nyi ma 'bum so son 'gran pa lta bu'i me tog mand'a ra ba dang / padma'i tshal rnams kyi nang na /
analyzed: lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor cing nyi ma 'bum so son 'gran pa lta bu'i me tog mand'a ra ba dang / padma'i tshal rnams kyi nang na /
translated: He is surrounded by a host of goddesses and is in the midst of groves of mandārava and lotus flowers, which are like a hundred thousand suns.

original: gser gyi bya sgra 'byin pa thos na rnar snyan pa dang / rol mo yan lag lnga dang ldan pa thos na snyan cing bde ba rnams kyi nang na mngon par dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: gser gyi bya sgra 'byin pa thos na rnar snyan pa dang / rol mo yan lag lnga dang ldan pa thos na snyan cing bde ba rnams kyi nang na mngon par dga' bar byed do //
translated: He is in the midst of golden birds that sing in a way that is delightful to the ear and of the sounds of the five types of musical instruments, which are delightful and pleasant.

original: gser dang / bee d'urya'i rdo leb kyi sa gzhi legs par bsnyams pa dang / mu tig gi bye ma sa gzhi bsnyams pa'i mtsho lha'i chu yon tan yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa rnams kyi nang na dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: gser dang / bee d'urya'i rdo leb kyi sa gzhi legs par bsnyams pa dang / mu tig gi bye ma sa gzhi bsnyams pa'i mtsho lha'i chu yon tan yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa rnams kyi nang na dga' bar byed do //
translated: He is in the midst of the waters of Lake Mandākinī, which have the eight qualities and are on a level golden and beryl surface, covered with sand of pearls.

original: rang gis byas pa'i bsod nams kyis sprul pa'i lhun po dag la /
analyzed: rang gis byas pa'i bsod nams kyis sprul pa'i lhun po dag la /
translated: He is in the midst of the peaks of the mountains that are emanated by his own merit.

original: gser dang / bee d'urya dang / dngul dang; shel gyi rdo yis mdzes par byas pa'i ri bzang po'i rtse mo dag na mngon par dga' bar byed de /
analyzed: gser dang / bee d'urya dang / dngul dang; shel gyi rdo yis mdzes par byas pa'i ri bzang po'i rtse mo dag na mngon par dga' bar byed de /
translated: They are beautiful with golden, beryl, silver, and crystal rocks.

original: dga' ba dang / skyid pa sna tshogs la gnas pa /
analyzed: dga' ba dang / skyid pa sna tshogs la gnas pa /
translated: He will experience various kinds of joy and happiness.

original: lha dang / lha mos dkrigs pa'i nang na dgod cing rtse la g-yer ba /🔽lha dang / lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba de ji srid du 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba rang gis byas shing bsags pa'i las de zad par ma gyur @130a *//
analyzed: lha dang / lha mos dkrigs pa'i nang na dgod cing rtse la g-yer ba / lha dang / lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba de ji srid du 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba rang gis byas shing bsags pa'i las de zad par ma gyur @130a *//
translated: He will laugh, play, and enjoy himself among the throngs of gods and goddesses.

original: pa de srid du rang gis legs par byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu la nye bar spyod par byed do //
analyzed: pa de srid du rang gis legs par byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu la nye bar spyod par byed do //
translated: Surrounded by a retinue of gods and goddesses, he will experience the effects of his own wholesome actions for as long as the actions that he himself has accumulated and created have not been exhausted.

original: gang gi tshe las zad par gyur pa dang / de phyis lha'i ris de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /🔽shi nas kyang gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i nang du ma skyes la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe las zad par gyur pa dang / de phyis lha'i ris de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te / shi nas kyang gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i nang du ma skyes la /
translated: “When his actions are exhausted, he will die and leave his divine world.

original: mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na /
analyzed: mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na /
translated: If he does not take birth as a hell being, a hungry ghost, or an animal due to karmic actions to be experienced in other lives, he may instead be born with the general lot in life of a human.

original: de las de dang rgyu mthun par rtag tu bde ba dang ldan zhing ri 'bigs byed kyi sman ljongs dag tu gnas pa dang / rgyal po'i yid ches par 'gyur ba mthong ngo //🔽de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
analyzed: de las de dang rgyu mthun par rtag tu bde ba dang ldan zhing ri 'bigs byed kyi sman ljongs dag tu gnas pa dang / rgyal po'i yid ches par 'gyur ba mthong ngo // de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
translated: In accordance with their causal actions, they will always be happy and live in the medicinal lands of the Vindhyas, and they will be trusted by the king.

original: lha rtag tu myos gnas rnams kyi gnas la rtog par byed de /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas /
analyzed: lha rtag tu myos gnas rnams kyi gnas la rtog par byed de / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas /
translated: “Next, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will examine the realm of the ever-infatuated gods.

original: lha rtag tu myos gnas rnams kyi gnas yul la 'dod pa zhes bya ba mthong ngo //🔽der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
analyzed: lha rtag tu myos gnas rnams kyi gnas yul la 'dod pa zhes bya ba mthong ngo // der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will see that the ever-infatuated gods have a realm called Desiring Objects.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /🔽sems dang ldan par gyur pa gang gis tshul khrims dang ldan yang rung /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na / sems dang ldan par gyur pa gang gis tshul khrims dang ldan yang rung /
translated: Wondering what karmic actions may cause beings to be born there, he will examine this matter with knowledge derived from hearing.🔽He will then notice that some people who are not disciplined in their minds,

original: mi ldan yang rung /🔽lta ba log kyang rung /
analyzed: mi ldan yang rung / lta ba log kyang rung /
translated: whether they are disciplined or not,🔽whether their views are wrong or not,

original: ma log kyang rung ba zhig nad kyis thebs pa la /
analyzed: ma log kyang rung ba zhig nad kyis thebs pa la /
translated: may, when they are sick,

original: nad rkyen dang / sman dang / g-yog dag byin la /
analyzed: nad rkyen dang / sman dang / g-yog dag byin la /
translated: He gives them medicine, nurses, and remedies.

original: de yang nad sos par gyur na /
analyzed: de yang nad sos par gyur na /
translated: If the patient recovers,

original: de lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten yul la dga' ba'i lha rnams @130b kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten yul la dga' ba'i lha rnams @130b kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then, when he separates from his body, he will go to the joyful higher realms and be born among the gods in the Heaven of Enjoying Emanations.

original: der skyes nas kyang 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral bar shes pa de /
analyzed: der skyes nas kyang 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral bar shes pa de /
translated: When he is born there, he will be free from all fear.

original: lha'i gnas gzhan dag tu mchod cing las 'phel ba las bde ba 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lha'i gnas gzhan dag tu mchod cing las 'phel ba las bde ba 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: In other divine abodes, he will be worshiped and his happiness will increase in accordance with his increased karmic actions.

original: ji ltar mar me 'bar ba las 'od 'byung ba de ltar las 'phel ba las bde ba 'phel bar 'gyur ro //🔽de ltar lha rnams lha'i 'jig rten na las kyi 'bras bu de la spyod pa rnam par smin pa shin tu nyams dga' ba /
analyzed: ji ltar mar me 'bar ba las 'od 'byung ba de ltar las 'phel ba las bde ba 'phel bar 'gyur ro // de ltar lha rnams lha'i 'jig rten na las kyi 'bras bu de la spyod pa rnam par smin pa shin tu nyams dga' ba /
translated: Just as light comes from a burning lamp, so happiness increases in accordance with increased karmic actions.

original: dpe med pa /
analyzed: dpe med pa /
translated: Thus, the gods in the divine worlds experience the results of their karmic actions, and they enjoy the most delightful and incomparable ripening of their actions.

original: thun mong ma yin pa dag 'byung ngo //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa dag 'byung ngo //
translated: They experience an extraordinary happiness.

original: legs par byas pa'i las des der skyes pa de bee d'urya dang / nor bu dang / dngul gyi lhun po gsal ba'i rtse mo mthon po rnams na shin tu bde bar gnas pa'i kun dga'i ra ba dag yod de /
analyzed: legs par byas pa'i las des der skyes pa de bee d'urya dang / nor bu dang / dngul gyi lhun po gsal ba'i rtse mo mthon po rnams na shin tu bde bar gnas pa'i kun dga'i ra ba dag yod de /
translated: Due to their positive actions, they are born there and dwell in the highest peaks of clear mountains of beryl, jewels, and silver.

original: skyed mos tshal dang / stegs bu du mas brgyan pa'i sa dag la gnas shing tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal rin po che sna bdun gyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: skyed mos tshal dang / stegs bu du mas brgyan pa'i sa dag la gnas shing tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal rin po che sna bdun gyis brgyan pa /
translated: They live in places adorned with many parks and terraces, and in forests and parks adorned with the seven precious substances.

original: 'od sna tshogs kyis yun ring du nyams dga' bar byed pa rnams kyi nang na lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor te /
analyzed: 'od sna tshogs kyis yun ring du nyams dga' bar byed pa rnams kyi nang na lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor te /
translated: For a long time, they enjoy themselves with various lights, surrounded by groups of goddesses.

original: de dag gis rtsed mo byed pa na /
analyzed: de dag gis rtsed mo byed pa na /
translated: When they play,

original: de ltar dbang po lha dang / blo yul la chags pa de ci dga' mgur bde ba la gnas te /
analyzed: de ltar dbang po lha dang / blo yul la chags pa de ci dga' mgur bde ba la gnas te /
translated: the gods of the sense faculties and the objects of their minds remain in whatever way is pleasurable.

original: ji srid du 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba byas shing bsags pa'i las de zad par ma gyur pa de srid du lha yul lha'i gnas de na 'dod pa thams cad la blo rnam par chags pa de /
analyzed: ji srid du 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba byas shing bsags pa'i las de zad par ma gyur pa de srid du lha yul lha'i gnas de na 'dod pa thams cad la blo rnam par chags pa de /
translated: As long as the effects of the karma of desirable, attractive, and delightful actions have not been exhausted, they will experience all the objects of desire in the divine realms.🔽

original: dga' bar byed /
analyzed: dga' bar byed /
translated: As long as the effects of their completed and accumulated actions that are attractive, desirable, and delightful have not been exhausted, they will continue to enjoy all pleasures in the divine realms.🔽“They will continue to enjoy themselves,

original: gnas par byed /
analyzed: gnas par byed /
translated: remain,

original: dga' mgur spyod par byed de /
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed de /
translated: and indulge in pleasures.

original: @131a *// de zad nas de nas yang las kyi 'bras bu la spyod pa ji lta ba bzhin sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //🔽gal te mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na /🔽de las de dang rgyu mthun par byed /
analyzed: @131a *// de zad nas de nas yang las kyi 'bras bu la spyod pa ji lta ba bzhin sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro // gal te mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na / de las de dang rgyu mthun par byed /
translated: When that has been exhausted, they will experience the effects of their actions and be born among hell beings, starving spirits, or animals.

original: gzugs bzang po dang ldan zhing gar yang 'jigs pa med pa dang / nor bzang po dang ldan pa dang / rgyal po'i 'khor gyis mchod pa dang / tshe ring ba dang / yul bzang por skye ste /
analyzed: gzugs bzang po dang ldan zhing gar yang 'jigs pa med pa dang / nor bzang po dang ldan pa dang / rgyal po'i 'khor gyis mchod pa dang / tshe ring ba dang / yul bzang por skye ste /
translated: “If they are born with the general lot in life of a human, they will, in accordance with their causal actions, be well proportioned and have nothing to fear. They will be wealthy, be worshiped by the king’s court, live long, and be born in a good place.

original: dus kyang chos bzang po la dga' ba'i dus su skye bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo //🔽de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des /🔽lha rtag tu myos gnas rnams kyi gnas la rtog par byed de /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas /
analyzed: dus kyang chos bzang po la dga' ba'i dus su skye bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo // de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des / lha rtag tu myos gnas rnams kyi gnas la rtog par byed de / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas /
translated: One will see that one will be born at a time when there is appreciation for the good Dharma.

original: lha rtag tu myos gnas rnams kyi gnas chu bsil gnas zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //🔽der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
analyzed: lha rtag tu myos gnas rnams kyi gnas chu bsil gnas zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo // der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
translated: “As the monk who has knowledge of the effects of the ripening of karmic actions continues to examine the realms of the ever-infatuated gods, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing and so correctly perceive a realm of the ever-infatuated gods known as Abiding in Cool Water.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: Wondering what karmic actions may cause beings to take birth there, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing.

original: snying rje can sems pas yongs su bsgoms pa'i snying dang ldan pa gang gis sems can gzhan 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe /
analyzed: snying rje can sems pas yongs su bsgoms pa'i snying dang ldan pa gang gis sems can gzhan 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe /
translated: He will then notice how some compassionate people who are thoroughly familiar with the practice of having a heart of compassion will, when other beings are dying,

original: skom gyis gdungs pa'i skom pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: skom gyis gdungs pa'i skom pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ram /
translated: give them water to drink in order to relieve their thirst.

original: gshin rje'i mi yis 'jigs pa bstan nas 'khrugs par gyur pa la bu ram chu'am /
analyzed: gshin rje'i mi yis 'jigs pa bstan nas 'khrugs par gyur pa la bu ram chu'am /
translated: Or, when others are frightened by the messengers of the Lord of Death, they may give them molasses water

original: chu grang mo blud na de legs par byas pa'i las kyi mthu des gang gi tshe @131b 'chi bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: chu grang mo blud na de legs par byas pa'i las kyi mthu des gang gi tshe @131b 'chi bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: If you give him cold water, that will be good.🔽By the power of that good karma, when he dies,

original: lha rtag tu myos gnas rnams kyi gnas chu bsil bar gnas zhes bya ba'i lha de dag gi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha rtag tu myos gnas rnams kyi gnas chu bsil bar gnas zhes bya ba'i lha de dag gi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are given cold water, the power of their wholesome actions will cause them to be born among the gods in the realm of Constant Ecstasy, in the divine world known as Abiding in Cool Waters.

original: der skyes nas kyang chu bsil ba'i tshogs 'bab chu dang / chu bo phun sum tshogs pa'i sa phyogs dag na de dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: der skyes nas kyang chu bsil ba'i tshogs 'bab chu dang / chu bo phun sum tshogs pa'i sa phyogs dag na de dga' bar byed do //
translated: “Once born there, they will enjoy themselves in the cool waters, waterfalls, and rivers.

original: de'i lha'i btung ba'i rnam pa 'di lta bu dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i lha'i btung ba'i rnam pa 'di lta bu dag 'byung bar 'gyur te / 'di lta ste /
translated: The following types of divine beverages will appear:

original: mthong na myos pa skyed pa dang / dris myos pa skyed pa dang / reg pas myos pa skyed pa dang / sgra thos na myos pa skyed par byed pa /
analyzed: mthong na myos pa skyed pa dang / dris myos pa skyed pa dang / reg pas myos pa skyed pa dang / sgra thos na myos pa skyed par byed pa /
translated: beverages that cause ecstasy when seen, beverages that cause ecstasy when smelled, beverages that cause ecstasy when touched, and beverages that cause ecstasy when heard.

original: myos pa'i skyon dang bral zhing snying dga' bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: myos pa'i skyon dang bral zhing snying dga' bar byed pa yin no //
translated: These beverages are free from the faults of intoxication and gladden the heart.

original: yon tan lnga dang ldan pa'i btung ba dag kyang 'byung ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: yon tan lnga dang ldan pa'i btung ba dag kyang 'byung ste /🔽'di lta ste /
translated: They also possess five qualities:

original: btung ba de dag 'thungs nas lha rnams lha'i stobs bcu 'gyur du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: btung ba de dag 'thungs nas lha rnams lha'i stobs bcu 'gyur du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When they drink this beverage, the gods will experience a tenfold increase in divine strength.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' la 'gro ba nyams par yang mi 'gyur zhing ltung bar yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' la 'gro ba nyams par yang mi 'gyur zhing ltung bar yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: “ ‘Just as they can move through the sky without losing their footing or falling,

original: de bzhin du sa la'ang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa la'ang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they will also be able to move on the ground.

original: de'i brtson 'grus yongs su nyams pa'ang med la ca co dang / ga zha'i sgra la mngon par dga' zhing yid shin tu dga' ba de rab tu dga' ba brgya 'gyur du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i brtson 'grus yongs su nyams pa'ang med la ca co dang / ga zha'i sgra la mngon par dga' zhing yid shin tu dga' ba de rab tu dga' ba brgya 'gyur du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Their diligence will not decline, and they will enjoy the sounds of laughter and play, experiencing a hundredfold increase in mental joy.

original: de'i rna ba'ang mnyan par bya ba la thogs pa med de /
analyzed: de'i rna ba'ang mnyan par bya ba la thogs pa med de /
translated: Their ears will be unimpeded in hearing,

original: shin tu bde ba yang dag par 'byung ba 'gyur ba; mtho ris dang mthun par gnas pa /
analyzed: shin tu bde ba yang dag par 'byung ba 'gyur ba; mtho ris dang mthun par gnas pa /
translated: and they will experience the arising of perfect bliss, abiding in accordance with the higher realms,

original: yul gyi bde ba nyams dga' ba dag myong bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul gyi bde ba nyams dga' ba dag myong bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and they will experience the delightful pleasures of the objects.

original: rin po che sna bdun gyi shing ljon pa'i tshal 'di lta bu dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun gyi shing ljon pa'i tshal 'di lta bu dag kyang yod de /
translated: “ ‘There are also forests of trees made of the seven precious substances.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

translated: He enjoys himself in the following parks: the Park of Joy, the Park of Delight, the Park of Blissful Abiding, the Park of Satisfaction, the Park of Gentle Breeze, the Park of the Five Sounds, the Park of the Melody of Falling Waters, the Park of Agreeable Mind, and the Park of Blissful Abiding.🔽With his eyes he sees desirable forms, attractive, pleasing, delightful.🔽With his ears he hears desirable sounds, agreeable, pleasing, delightful.🔽

original: de lta de sred pa'i tshogs drug gi mes nyin gcig bzhin sreg par byed la /
analyzed: de lta de sred pa'i tshogs drug gi mes nyin gcig bzhin sreg par byed la /
translated: In this way, the fire of the sixfold collection of craving burns them day after day.

original: 'dod chags kyi mes kyang nyin gcig bzhin yongs su sreg ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi mes kyang nyin gcig bzhin yongs su sreg ste /
translated: The fire of attachment also burns them day after day.

original: 'dod chags kyi me dang / bag med pa'i me lce drug shin tu stobs che bar gyur kyang de dag des mi rig go /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi me dang / bag med pa'i me lce drug shin tu stobs che bar gyur kyang de dag des mi rig go /
translated: Even though the six tongues of the fire of attachment and the fire of carelessness are very powerful, they do not notice it.

original: bag med pa des yid phrogs shing bag med pa'i gnas su skyes pa /
analyzed: bag med pa des yid phrogs shing bag med pa'i gnas su skyes pa /
translated: They are carried away by carelessness and are born in a place of carelessness.

original: bag med pa des nyams pa /
analyzed: bag med pa des nyams pa /
translated: They are destroyed by carelessness.

original: legs par byas pa'i las des yul gyi bde ba la lhag par dga' ba zad pa med pa de ni ji srid du 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba byas shing bsags pa'i las de zad par ma gyur pa de srid du de nas bde ba myong🔽bar @132b byed do //
analyzed: legs par byas pa'i las des yul gyi bde ba la lhag par dga' ba zad pa med pa de ni ji srid du 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba byas shing bsags pa'i las de zad par ma gyur pa de srid du de nas bde ba myong bar @132b byed do //
translated: They enjoy the pleasures of the objects without limit, until finally the previously created and accumulated karma that is to be experienced as pleasure is exhausted.

original: gang gi tshe las zad par gyur pa dang / de phyis lha'i 'jig rten de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe las zad par gyur pa dang / de phyis lha'i 'jig rten de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
translated: When that karma is exhausted, they die and leave that divine world.

original: shi nas kyang gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i nang du ma skyes la /
analyzed: shi nas kyang gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i nang du ma skyes la /
translated: After death, if they do not take birth in the realms of hell beings, starving spirits, or animals due to karmic actions to be experienced in other lives,

original: mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na /
analyzed: mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na /
translated: they may be born with the general lot in life of a human.

original: de las de dang rgyu mthun par bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / ngal ba dang; lo nyes 'byung ba'i 'jigs pa yang mi 'byung la /
analyzed: de las de dang rgyu mthun par bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / ngal ba dang; lo nyes 'byung ba'i 'jigs pa yang mi 'byung la /
translated: In that case, they will, in accordance with their causal actions, not experience the terrors of hunger, thirst, exhaustion, or famine.

original: rtag par shin tu bde bar gnas pa dang / yul ma mthong ba rnams su 'ongs na yang dga' ba dang / mgu bar 'gyur ba dang / de la bya ba med bzhin du'ang mal stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman gyi rkyen gyis yo byad mang po dag sbyin pa byed pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: rtag par shin tu bde bar gnas pa dang / yul ma mthong ba rnams su 'ongs na yang dga' ba dang / mgu bar 'gyur ba dang / de la bya ba med bzhin du'ang mal stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman gyi rkyen gyis yo byad mang po dag sbyin pa byed pa mthong ngo //
translated: They will always be very happy, and even when they arrive in places they have never seen before, they will be delighted and pleased. Without having to do anything, they will receive many provisions, such as bedding and medical supplies.

original: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de; lha rtag tu myos gnas rnams kyi gnas la rtog par byed de /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de; lha rtag tu myos gnas rnams kyi gnas la rtog par byed de /
translated: “Next, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will examine the realm of the constantly merry gods.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas lha rtag tu myos gnas rnams kyi gnas brtan dga' zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo; ;der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /🔽gang gis spong ba'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i dge slong yid skyo bar bya ba'i phyir mi ro'am /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas lha rtag tu myos gnas rnams kyi gnas brtan dga' zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo; ;der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na / gang gis spong ba'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i dge slong yid skyo bar bya ba'i phyir mi ro'am /
translated: Wondering what karmic actions may cause beings to be born there,

original: mi ro lta bur bris pa zhig bzhag na /
analyzed: mi ro lta bur bris pa zhig bzhag na /

original: de bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten brtan dga'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten brtan dga'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: As a result, they will be born in the joyful realm of the gods in the higher realms.

original: der skyes nas kyang rtag @133a *//
analyzed: der skyes nas kyang rtag @133a *//
translated: Once born there, they will always

original: tu brtan dga' de bee d'urya dang / gser dang / byu ru dang / aanda rnyil dang / margad lta bu'i mtho ris kyi gnas dag na yang dang / yang du dga' bar byed cing nyin gcig bzhin du bde ba par chad med pa 'bum snyed dag myong bar byed do //
analyzed: tu brtan dga' de bee d'urya dang / gser dang / byu ru dang / aanda rnyil dang / margad lta bu'i mtho ris kyi gnas dag na yang dang / yang du dga' bar byed cing nyin gcig bzhin du bde ba par chad med pa 'bum snyed dag myong bar byed do //
translated: He will enjoy himself again and again in the heavenly realms, which are as firm as lapis lazuli, gold, coral, sapphire, and emerald, and he will experience hundreds of thousands of uninterrupted pleasures every day.

original: rol mo mang po du ma 'bum snyed dag mang du thos na bar chad med par dga' ba lhag par chags te /
analyzed: rol mo mang po du ma 'bum snyed dag mang du thos na bar chad med par dga' ba lhag par chags te /
translated: When he hears the many hundreds of thousands of musical instruments, he will be even more attached to his pleasures.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni dper byar yang med la /🔽mtho ris su zas dang / skom dang / gos dang / me tog dang / dris myos shing dga' ba mang po du ma 'byung ngo; ;der dga' ba 'di lta bu dag 'byung ste /

analyzed: spos sna tshogs kyis phog na dga' ba dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba'i tshogs na dga' ba dang / rtsen pas dga' ba dang / nam mkha' la 'gro bas dga' ba dang / snying du sdug pa'i lha mthong na dga' ba dang / rin po che'i ri'i rtse mo nas ri'i rtse mo blta na dga' ba ste / de dag la sogs pas mngon par dga' la /
translated: delighted to be struck by various perfumes, delighted by the collection of food and drink, delighted by play, delighted to travel through the sky, delighted to see dear gods, and delighted to see the peaks of the jeweled mountains.🔽They are delighted by these and other things.

original: dga' ba du ma gzhan rnams la yang shin tu chags te /
analyzed: dga' ba du ma gzhan rnams la yang shin tu chags te /
translated: They are also extremely attached to many other delights.

original: bde ba shin tu yid du 'ong ba'i kun dga' @133b ra ba dang / sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i glu dbyangs len pa dang / rang gis byas pa'i bde ba la gnas pa lha'i bde ba rnam pa du ma de dag ji srid du 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong pa legs par byas pa'i las de zad par ma gyur ba de srid du myong bar byed do //
analyzed: bde ba shin tu yid du 'ong ba'i kun dga' @133b ra ba dang / sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i glu dbyangs len pa dang / rang gis byas pa'i bde ba la gnas pa lha'i bde ba rnam pa du ma de dag ji srid du 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong pa legs par byas pa'i las de zad par ma gyur ba de srid du myong bar byed do //
translated: In the delightful parks, with their extremely pleasant pleasures, and with the songs of the five types of instruments, they experience the pleasures they have created for themselves. They experience these many divine pleasures for as long as their virtuous actions have not come to an end.

analyzed: las de zad nas de nas yang lha'i 'jig rten de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
translated: When their actions are exhausted, they will die and leave their divine world.

original: shi nas kyang gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i nang du ma skyes la /
analyzed: shi nas kyang gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i nang du ma skyes la /

translated: In accordance with their causal actions, they will live in various parks and experience great happiness, wearing various garments, enjoying various conversations, engaging in various activities, and seeing various things to behold.

original: de nas yang dge slong des rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams kyi gnas gsum dang / las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa rnam par phye nas gnas bzhi pa la rtog par byed de /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong des rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams kyi gnas gsum dang / las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa rnam par phye nas gnas bzhi pa la rtog par byed de /

analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas pi wang can gsum pa zhes bya ba'i lha rnams mthong ngo //

original: de rnams kyi gnas bcu po yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi gnas bcu po yang 'di lta ste /
translated: He will see that they have ten realms:

original: dri dga' dang / sgra snyan pa dang / de la chags dang / skyor chu skyes dang / lus dkar dang / phan tshun dga' dang / yang dag chags spyod dang / 'khor dang / rnam spyod dang / @134a *//

translated: the gods of Delight in Emanations, the gods of Delight in Others’ Emanations, the gods of Great Delight in Emanations, the gods of Delight in Song, the gods of Delight in Beautiful Sounds, the gods of Attachment, the gods of Water-born, the gods of White Bodies, the gods of Mutual Delight, the gods of Right Conduct, the gods of Assembly, and the gods of Conduct.

analyzed: skyil mo krung gi steng du skye ba dang ldan par gnas pa dag ste /

analyzed: lha pi wang can gsum pa rnams kyi gnas ni bcu po de dag yin no //

analyzed: dge slong de de rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa rnam par 'byed par byed de /

analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na / 'di ltar las de dag byed na de ltar de dang mthun par skye bar 'gyur la /

analyzed: las de dang mthun par rnam par smin pa 'byung ngo //

analyzed: des sems bsgoms pa des lus bsgoms pa gang gis bsod nams bsags par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: dge 'dun dag la kun dga' ra ba'i sa'am / bu ram shing gi ra ba'am /

analyzed: 'bra go'i ra ba'am / shing aa mra'i ra ba phul la /

analyzed: gos gyon pa /

analyzed: yang lha'i dri des brgya 'gyur du myos par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de ltar de na gnas pa de ni /
translated: “While they live there,

analyzed: 'di ltar byu ru'i tshal zhes bya ba gnas de dag tu sil snyan dang glu dbyangs sna tshogs kyi sgra 'byin cing dgod pa dang / shin tu yid dga' ba'i grogs po rnams dang lhan cig tshal der 'dong bar byed do //
translated: Thus, in the so-called Beryl Grove, they will go to the parks to the sounds of various musical instruments and songs, and together with their delightful companions.

original: de ltar de dag byu ru'i tshal gyi nang du 'dong ste /
analyzed: de ltar de dag byu ru'i tshal gyi nang du 'dong ste /
translated: “When they enter the Beryl Grove,

analyzed: gang gi tshe zhugs pa dang / bya sna tshogs sgra 'byin cing gser btso ma'i shing ljon pas mdzes pa yin no //
translated: the birds will sing and the grove will be beautified by trees of refined gold.

original: shing ljon pa'i nye ba'i tshal gyis mdzes par byas pa'i byu ru'i tshal de'i mthu ni 'di lta bu yin te /
analyzed: shing ljon pa'i nye ba'i tshal gyis mdzes par byas pa'i byu ru'i tshal de'i mthu ni 'di lta bu yin te /
translated: The power of the Beryl Grove, which is beautified by the trees, is such that

original: ji ltar kha dog dmar po gzhan dang mi mthun par 'byung ba de ltar shing ljon pa'i 'od dmar po rnam pa de lta bu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar kha dog dmar po gzhan dang mi mthun par 'byung ba de ltar shing ljon pa'i 'od dmar po rnam pa de lta bu 'byung ngo //
translated: just as the color red is unlike any other color, so the red light of the trees will be unlike any other.

original: lha de dag thams cad tshal de'i mthus dkar po de rnams dang bral nas kha dog shin tu dmar por gyur pa dang / phan tshun gtam du bdag cag gi lus lhan cig skyes pa'i mdzes pa gang yin pa de dag tshal gyi kha dog gi mthus mi snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: lha de dag thams cad tshal de'i mthus dkar po de rnams dang bral nas kha dog shin tu dmar por gyur pa dang / phan tshun gtam du bdag cag gi lus lhan cig skyes pa'i mdzes pa gang yin pa de dag tshal gyi kha dog gi mthus mi snang bar gyur to //
translated: They say to each other, “Whatever natural beauty our bodies had has disappeared due to the power of the color of the forest.”

original: shing ljon pa de dag kun nas kha dog dmar po kho na yin te /
analyzed: shing ljon pa de dag kun nas kha dog dmar po kho na yin te /
translated: Those trees are all just red in color.

original: bdag cag ni tshal gzhan du 'dong bar bya'o zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bdag cag ni tshal gzhan du 'dong bar bya'o zhes brjod do //
translated: We should go to another forest.”

original: de nas lha de rnams lha mo de dag dang lhan cig bee d'urya'i tshal ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
analyzed: de nas lha de rnams lha mo de dag dang lhan cig bee d'urya'i tshal ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
translated: Then, together with those goddesses, the gods go to the beryl forest.

original: tshal de yang bee d'urya'i mdog des ji ltar dzambu'i gling gi gnam @143b ltar kun nas sngo ba yin no //
analyzed: tshal de yang bee d'urya'i mdog des ji ltar dzambu'i gling gi gnam @143b ltar kun nas sngo ba yin no //
translated: That forest is completely blue like the sky over Jambudvīpa due to the color of the beryl.

original: de nas lha rnams tshal der yang kha dog dkar po gang yin pa de dag bee d'urya'i shing ljon pa'i dbyibs de rnams kyis kyang zil gyis mnan te /
analyzed: de nas lha rnams tshal der yang kha dog dkar po gang yin pa de dag bee d'urya'i shing ljon pa'i dbyibs de rnams kyis kyang zil gyis mnan te /
translated: Then, in that forest, the gods whose bodies are white outshine the trees of beryl in color and shape.

original: shing de rnams la bya gnas pa gang yin pa de dag kha dog sngon por gyur la /
analyzed: shing de rnams la bya gnas pa gang yin pa de dag kha dog sngon por gyur la /

original: padma gang yin pa de dag kyang sngon por gyur te /
analyzed: padma gang yin pa de dag kyang sngon por gyur te /

original: de ltar bee d'urya'i tshal de dag thams cad sngon po nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bee d'urya'i tshal de dag thams cad sngon po nyid yin no //
translated: In this way, everything in the forest of beryl is blue.

original: de nas lus dkar ba lha mo'i tshogs mang pos yongs su bskor ba lha'i rol mo'i sgra dang / dri dang / glu dbyangs dang bcas pa rnams tshal de na yun ring du dga' bar byed /
analyzed: de nas lus dkar ba lha mo'i tshogs mang pos yongs su bskor ba lha'i rol mo'i sgra dang / dri dang / glu dbyangs dang bcas pa rnams tshal de na yun ring du dga' bar byed /
translated: Then, the gods whose bodies are white, surrounded by many groups of goddesses, with the sounds of divine music, fragrances, and songs, enjoy themselves for a long time in that forest.

original: rtse bar byed /🔽dga' mgur spyod par byed cing /
analyzed: rtse bar byed / dga' mgur spyod par byed cing /
translated: They play,

original: lha'i bde ba 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga myong bar byed do //
analyzed: lha'i bde ba 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga myong bar byed do //
translated: and experience divine pleasures and the five sensory objects.

original: de nas yun ring zhig lon nas lha lus dkar po rnams rtse ba'i don du dngul gyi shing ljon pa'i tshal du 'dor bar byed do //
analyzed: de nas yun ring zhig lon nas lha lus dkar po rnams rtse ba'i don du dngul gyi shing ljon pa'i tshal du 'dor bar byed do //

analyzed: dngul gyi tshal de nas kun nas kha dog dkar por snang zhing tshal de na gang ci yod pa de thams cad dkar ba yin la /

analyzed: tshal de na padma yang dngul gyi padma shin tu nyams dga' ba yin no //

original: bya rnams kyang dngul gyi bya yin te /
analyzed: bya rnams kyang dngul gyi bya yin te /
translated: The birds are also silver birds.

original: de ltar lha lus dkar po dang ldan pa de dag thams cad tshal de'i nang du zhugs pa ji ltar 'o ma'i nang na zla ba'i gzugs brnyan snang ba de ltar mdzes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar lha lus dkar po dang ldan pa de dag thams cad tshal de'i nang du zhugs pa ji ltar 'o ma'i nang na zla ba'i gzugs brnyan snang ba de ltar mdzes pa yin no //

original: tshal de na lha rnams yun ring du dga' bar byed /
analyzed: tshal de na lha rnams yun ring du dga' bar byed /
translated: The gods enjoy themselves for a long time in that forest.

analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed cing lha'i dpe med pa 'dod pa'i bde ba yan lag lnga dang ldan pas @144a *//
translated: They experience divine, incomparable, and complete pleasure with the five types of sense objects.

original: bde ba myong bar byed do //
analyzed: bde ba myong bar byed do //
translated: They experience pleasure.

original: de dag der yang dga' bar byas nas lus sna tshogs ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag der yang dga' bar byas nas lus sna tshogs ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
translated: Having enjoyed themselves there, they will then go to the forest known as Various Bodies.

original: tshal de yang shing ljon pa sna tshogs kyis mdzes par byas shing gser gyi shing ljon pa rnams kyis kyang mdzes par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: tshal de yang shing ljon pa sna tshogs kyis mdzes par byas shing gser gyi shing ljon pa rnams kyis kyang mdzes par byas pa yin te /
translated: “This forest is also beautified by various trees, including golden trees,

original: de bzhin du dngul gyi shing ljon pa rnams dang / de bzhin du bee d'urya'i shing ljon pa rnams dang / de bzhin du lo ma sna tshogs rnams kyis mdzes par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngul gyi shing ljon pa rnams dang / de bzhin du bee d'urya'i shing ljon pa rnams dang / de bzhin du lo ma sna tshogs rnams kyis mdzes par byas pa yin no //
translated: silver trees, beryl trees, and trees with various leaves.

original: shing de rnams kyang kha dog sna tshogs kyi lo ma dang / mdog sna tshogs kyis mdzes pa yin la /
analyzed: shing de rnams kyang kha dog sna tshogs kyi lo ma dang / mdog sna tshogs kyis mdzes pa yin la /
translated: The trees have leaves of various colors and are beautified by various hues.

analyzed: tshal de'i nang na lha de rnams de dag nyid kyis lus rnams rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan par gyur to //

original: tshal de na yang lha de rnams yun ring du dga' bar byed /
analyzed: tshal de na yang lha de rnams yun ring du dga' bar byed /
translated: Within this forest, the gods enjoy themselves for a long time.🔽They experience pleasures

original: dga' mgur spyod par byed de /
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed de /
translated: and enjoy themselves.

original: lha mo'i tshogs kyi nang na 'khod pa rnams de dag gis glu dbyangs nye bar len cing de na yang de rnams yun ring du rtses nas kun tu mthong ba'i gser gyi ri ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
analyzed: lha mo'i tshogs kyi nang na 'khod pa rnams de dag gis glu dbyangs nye bar len cing de na yang de rnams yun ring du rtses nas kun tu mthong ba'i gser gyi ri ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
translated: The gods who are in the midst of the assembly of goddesses will sing songs to them. After they have played there for a long time, they will go to the golden mountain called All-Seeing.

original: de yang rin po che sna bdun gyis brgyan pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang rin po che sna bdun gyis brgyan pa yin te /
translated: “That mountain is adorned with the seven precious substances.

analyzed: lha de dag gis ri kun mthong chu bo dang / 'bab chu dang / lteng ka mang pos brgyan pa /
translated: The gods will see the mountain, which is adorned with many rivers, waterfalls, and ponds,

original: tshal dang / nags tshal dang ldan pa /
analyzed: tshal dang / nags tshal dang ldan pa /
translated: and which is endowed with forests and groves.

original: padma'i rdzing du mas 'khor ba /
analyzed: padma'i rdzing du mas 'khor ba /

analyzed: bya'i tshogs mang po'i sgra 'byin pa'i ri bo de la 'dzegs nas ri'i rgyal po ri rab drug khris bskor ba de rnams kyi dbus na ri'i rgyal po ri rab 'dug pa de dag @144b thams cad mthong ngo //
translated: When they have climbed that mountain, they will see the king of mountains, Mount Sumeru, which is surrounded by sixty thousand other mountain kings.

analyzed: de nas lha lus dkar po rnams kun nas mthong ba'i ri bo de la lha mo dang lhan cig yun ring du rtse bar byed /
translated: “The gods of the Heaven of the Luminous will see the mountain called All-Seeing and play with the goddesses for a long time.

original: dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
translated: They enjoy themselves as they please.

original: de nas yang de rnams de las babs nas ri bo phyogs gtsang ma zhes bya ba ga la ba der 'dzeg par byed de /
analyzed: de nas yang de rnams de las babs nas ri bo phyogs gtsang ma zhes bya ba ga la ba der 'dzeg par byed de /

analyzed: ri bo de la yang gnas gzhan dag nas skyes pa'i lha rnams dga' ba'i mthus ri bo de la 'ongs nas dga' bar byed do //
translated: The gods who have been born in other places also come to that mountain and enjoy themselves by the power of their merit.

original: lha gzhan de rnams dang lha lus dkar po de rnams dang yang phan tshun lhan cig sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pas dga' bar byed cing dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
analyzed: lha gzhan de rnams dang lha lus dkar po de rnams dang yang phan tshun lhan cig sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pas dga' bar byed cing dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
translated: The gods and the gods with white bodies enjoy themselves together with the five types of musical instruments.

analyzed: de nas lha yul gyi phyogs cha dga' ba de rnams su lha de dag yun ring du dga' bar byas nas /

analyzed: mar zad nas mar me 'chi bar 'gyur zhing nyin par gyi mtha' zad na nyi ma nub par 'gyur ba de ltar lha de rnams legs par byas pa'i las zad nas mar me ltar lha'i 'jig rten de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
translated: Just as a lamp goes out when the oil is used up, and just as the end of the day comes when the sun sets, so too, when the gods’ good karma is used up, they die and leave that divine world, like a lamp going out.

original: shi nas kyang nye bar 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shi nas kyang nye bar 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After death, they go to the realms of hell beings, starving spirits, and animals, in accordance with their actions.

original: gal te mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na //
analyzed: gal te mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na //
translated: If they are born with the general lot in life of a human,

analyzed: de las de dang rgyu mthun par padma'i rtsa lag lta bur mdog dkar sham bzang por 'gyur zhing stong phyogs sam /

original: rgya yul la sogs par skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: rgya yul la sogs par skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: such as in the land of China.

analyzed: rtag tu bde ba dang ldan pa dang / mi'i gtso bo chen po'i yid gcugs par 'gyur ba mthong ngo //🔽de nas @145a *//
