original: yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de lha pi wang can gsum pa rnams kyi gnas su rtog par byed de /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de lha pi wang can gsum pa rnams kyi gnas su rtog par byed de / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: “The monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will further examine the realm of the third class of gods who play the lute.

original: lha'i 'jig rten na lha phan tshun dga' ba zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: lha'i 'jig rten na lha phan tshun dga' ba zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then notice that in the world of the gods there is a realm known as Mutual Joy.

original: gnas der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: gnas der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: Wondering what karmic actions may cause beings to take birth there, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing.

original: sems can dge ba phan tshun grogs su gyur pa /
analyzed: sems can dge ba phan tshun grogs su gyur pa /
translated: He will then notice that some virtuous beings who are friends to each other

original: sems pa dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sems pa dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa /
translated: and who are endowed with thoughtfulness and discipline

original: grol ba'i dge 'dun gyi gtso bor gyur pa gang dag gis sbyin pa byin /
analyzed: grol ba'i dge 'dun gyi gtso bor gyur pa gang dag gis sbyin pa byin /
translated: may become leaders of the liberated saṅgha and thus give generously🔽and maintain discipline.

original: tshul khrims bsrungs na de dag thams cad rgyu de dang rkyen de las lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten phan tshun dga' ba'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims bsrungs na de dag thams cad rgyu de dang rkyen de las lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten phan tshun dga' ba'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When they later separate from their bodies, they will go to the joyful higher realms and be born among the gods in Mutual Joy.

original: der skyes nas kyang phan tshun bde ba bskyed cing sems mthun par bskyed pa de rnams bsod nams kyi tshogs smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der skyes nas kyang phan tshun bde ba bskyed cing sems mthun par bskyed pa de rnams bsod nams kyi tshogs smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Once born there, they will mutually generate bliss and create concord in their minds, and their accumulations of merit will ripen.

original: de na lha'i padma'i rdzing na gnas shing kha zas la dga' ba de yul nyams dga' zhing bde ba dag myong bar byed de /
analyzed: de na lha'i padma'i rdzing na gnas shing kha zas la dga' ba de yul nyams dga' zhing bde ba dag myong bar byed de /
translated: “There, in the divine lotus ponds, they will enjoy food and delight in the pleasant objects and bliss.

original: sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pas yid rab tu dga' ba dag dgod par byed /
analyzed: sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pas yid rab tu dga' ba dag dgod par byed /

original: dga' bar byed /
analyzed: dga' bar byed /

analyzed: rtse bar byed; dga' mgur spyod par byed la /

analyzed: lha mo'i tshogs gzugs dang / cha byad sna tshogs dang ldan pa rnams kyis yongs su bskor nas gser dang / rin po che sna tshogs kyi sa gzhi dang / @145b ri de rnams la dga' bar byed do //
translated: Surrounded by hosts of goddesses with various forms and costumes, they will enjoy themselves on the ground of gold and various jewels and on the mountains.

analyzed: de ltar rang gi las kyi 'bras bu la spyod cing dga' ba de rnams su chu bo'i 'gram bee d'urya dang / nor bu'i lan kan bres pa dang / gser gyi rnam pa'i bya ngang pa dang / dur pa rnams kyis mdzes par byas la /
translated: Thus, enjoying the fruits of their own actions, they delight in the riverbanks, which are adorned with nets of lapis lazuli and jewels, and beautified by golden geese and ducks.

original: 'gram na shing ljon pa skyes pa rnams kyi sdug gur brgyan pa'i sman ljongs dag na lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba rnams dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: 'gram na shing ljon pa skyes pa rnams kyi sdug gur brgyan pa'i sman ljongs dag na lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba rnams dga' bar byed do //
translated: On the riverbanks grow trees with beautiful flowers and fruits, and the gods and goddesses enjoy themselves in the groves.

analyzed: der de dag dga' bar byas nas mu tig 'bab par byed pa zhes bya ba'i chu bo ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
translated: “Having enjoyed themselves there, they will proceed to a river called Falling Pearls.

analyzed: chu bo de dag na chu gang yin pa de dag ni chang ro rnam pa du ma dang ldan pa rnyog pa med pa 'bab bo // bye ma gang yin pa de dag ni mu tig yin la /
translated: The water in that river is a clear beer with many flavors.🔽The sand is pearls,

original: 'dam rdzab gang yin pa de dag ni gser yin te /
analyzed: 'dam rdzab gang yin pa de dag ni gser yin te /
translated: and the mud is gold.

original: chu bo de nor bu kha dog bzang po du mas brgyan pa nya rnams kyis shin tu mdzes pa yin no //🔽de'i ngos gnyis ka na gser gyi shing ljon pa rnams la 'dab ma ni bee d'urya /
analyzed: chu bo de nor bu kha dog bzang po du mas brgyan pa nya rnams kyis shin tu mdzes pa yin no // de'i ngos gnyis ka na gser gyi shing ljon pa rnams la 'dab ma ni bee d'urya /
translated: The river is adorned with many beautiful jewels and is very lovely with its fish.🔽On both sides of the river are golden trees with beryl leaves,

original: bee d'urya'i shing ljon pa rnams la gser gyi 'dab ma yod de /
analyzed: bee d'urya'i shing ljon pa rnams la gser gyi 'dab ma yod de /

translated: Beings have created,

original: rnam pa de tsam de'i bde ba //
analyzed: rnam pa de tsam de'i bde ba //
translated: That much happiness

original: lha yi 'jig rten rnams su smin //
analyzed: lha yi 'jig rten rnams su smin //
translated: Will ripen in the world of the gods.’

original: de ltar 'phags skyes po des lha de dag mthong ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'phags skyes po des lha de dag mthong ste /
translated: In this way, Virūḍhaka sees the gods.

original: tshigs su bcad pa smras nas /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa smras nas /
translated: Having spoken these verses,

original: de dag nyid dang lhan cig mthun par dga' bar byed de /
analyzed: de dag nyid dang lhan cig mthun par dga' bar byed de /
translated: he delights in harmony with them.

original: ri dang / nags tshal dang / lteng ka dang / tshal dang / lha'i me tog dang / 'bras bur ldan pa'i sa phyogs dang / bya sna tshogs sgra 'byin pa dang / kun nas lha mo'i tshogs kyis gang ba dang / ri mthong na nyams dga' ba dang /
analyzed: ri dang / nags tshal dang / lteng ka dang / tshal dang / lha'i me tog dang / 'bras bur ldan pa'i sa phyogs dang / bya sna tshogs sgra 'byin pa dang / kun nas lha mo'i tshogs kyis gang ba dang / ri mthong na nyams dga' ba dang /
translated: In places endowed with mountains, forests, ponds, groves, divine flowers, and fruits, with birds singing in every direction, filled with hosts of goddesses, with mountains that are delightful to behold,

original: dbang po drug bde bar byed pa rnams su /
analyzed: dbang po drug bde bar byed pa rnams su /
translated: and that bring pleasure to the six senses,

original: dbang po drug don la chags pa bag med par gnas pa'i lha de rnams sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pas mngon par dga' bar byed cing /
analyzed: dbang po drug don la chags pa bag med par gnas pa'i lha de rnams sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pas mngon par dga' bar byed cing /
translated: the gods, who are attached to the objects of the six senses and who live carelessly, enjoy themselves with the five types of musical instruments.

original: padma'i tshal dang / skyed mos tshal dang / chang chu ltar 'bab pa dang / bee d'urya'i tshal dang / lteng ka dang / chu mig gis brgyan pa phan tshun grogs su gyur pa rnams /
analyzed: padma'i tshal dang / skyed mos tshal dang / chang chu ltar 'bab pa dang / bee d'urya'i tshal dang / lteng ka dang / chu mig gis brgyan pa phan tshun grogs su gyur pa rnams /
translated: In lotus groves, parks, waterfalls, beryl groves, ponds, and springs, they are each other’s friends.

original: ji srid du 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba legs par byas pa'i las de zad par ma gyur pa de srid du dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: ji srid du 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba legs par byas pa'i las de zad par ma gyur pa de srid du dga' bar byed do //
translated: As long as the effects of their past positive actions have not been exhausted, they will continue to enjoy themselves.

original: de zad nas de nas yang lha'i ris de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de zad nas de nas yang lha'i ris de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
translated: When that happens, they will die and leave their divine world.

original: shi nas kyang las nye bar 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //🔽gal te lan grangs @151b gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na /
analyzed: shi nas kyang las nye bar 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro // gal te lan grangs @151b gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na /
translated: In accordance with their causal actions, they will then be born among hell beings, starving spirits, or animals.

original: de las de dang rgyu mthun par mang du smra ba /
analyzed: de las de dang rgyu mthun par mang du smra ba /
translated: If, due to karmic actions to be experienced in other lives, they should be born with the general lot in life of a human, they will, in accordance with their causal actions, become great traders.

original: nor mang ba /🔽ded dpon chen por 'gyur ba mthong ngo; ;de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /🔽lha pi wang can gsum pa rnams kyi gnas la rtog par byed de /
analyzed: nor mang ba / ded dpon chen por 'gyur ba mthong ngo; ;de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de / lha pi wang can gsum pa rnams kyi gnas la rtog par byed de /
translated: They will have many possessions🔽and be great leaders.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas /
translated: “As the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects continues to examine the realm of the gods, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing and so correctly perceive the realm of the gods known as Those of the Triple Lute.

original: de dag gi gnas 'khor dang / spyod pa zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: de dag gi gnas 'khor dang / spyod pa zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
translated: He sees their abodes, retinues, and activities.

original: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
analyzed: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
translated: Inquiring into what karmic actions may cause one to be born there,

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: he will apply knowledge derived from hearing and thus perceive that

original: tshul khrims dang ldan par gyur cing /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan par gyur cing /
translated: some people who are endowed with discipline🔽and who have cultivated their mind-streams with thoughts

original: sems kyi rgyud sems pas bsgoms pa gang gis sbyin pa sbyin /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud sems pas bsgoms pa gang gis sbyin pa sbyin /
translated: may give gifts, observe discipline,

original: tshul khrims bsrungs /
analyzed: tshul khrims bsrungs /
translated: and listen to the Dharma.

original: chos mnyan par byas pa'i sbyin bdag de la lag nas sbyin pa po grogs su gyur pa gzhan zhig /
analyzed: chos mnyan par byas pa'i sbyin bdag de la lag nas sbyin pa po grogs su gyur pa gzhan zhig /
translated: When such a benefactor gives to others,

original: des snying brlan cing dge ba'i sems dang ldan pa /🔽dad pas sems brlan pa /
analyzed: des snying brlan cing dge ba'i sems dang ldan pa / dad pas sems brlan pa /
translated: his friends will be inspired and develop virtuous minds.🔽With faith, their minds will be moistened.

original: 'di ltar yang sems la rtog par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang sems la rtog par byed de /
translated: They will think,

original: sbyin bdag 'di ni bsod nams dang ldan pa zhig go /
analyzed: sbyin bdag 'di ni bsod nams dang ldan pa zhig go /
translated: ‘This benefactor is endowed with merit.

original: de bdag la'ang rdzas kyi rnam pa de snyed yod na /
analyzed: de bdag la'ang rdzas kyi rnam pa de snyed yod na /
translated: If I had that much wealth,

original: de ltar bdag gis kyang gzhan dag la sbyin par bya'o snyam sems ma sbyin pa la sems dang ba des lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten 'khor dang spyod pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang gzhan dag la sbyin par bya'o snyam sems ma sbyin pa la sems dang ba des lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten 'khor dang spyod pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thinking, ‘I too should give to others,’ they give with a pure mind. When they later separate from their bodies, they will go to the joyful higher realms and be born among the gods in the Heaven of the Assembly of the Joyous.

original: der skyes nas kyang yul du mas snying rab tu myos pa rnams rtag tu ldan par gyur @152a *//🔽te; sil snyan sna tshogs sgra 'byin pa'i nye ba'i tshal dang / bee d'urya dang / nor bu'i lan kan bres pa'i rdzing rnams na gser gyi padmas khebs pa dang / bya'i tshogs kyi rnam pa sgra 'byin pa'i tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal de rnams na /
analyzed: der skyes nas kyang yul du mas snying rab tu myos pa rnams rtag tu ldan par gyur @152a *// te; sil snyan sna tshogs sgra 'byin pa'i nye ba'i tshal dang / bee d'urya dang / nor bu'i lan kan bres pa'i rdzing rnams na gser gyi padmas khebs pa dang / bya'i tshogs kyi rnam pa sgra 'byin pa'i tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal de rnams na /
translated: “Once born there, they will be constantly accompanied by the gods of the Assembly of the Joyous, who are intoxicated by numerous objects.🔽In the forests and parks, where the sounds of various musical instruments resound, there are ponds with railings made of beryl and jewels, covered with golden lotuses, and filled with flocks of birds that sing delightfully.

original: bya myos pa sgra 'byin pa nyams dga' bar byed pa dag na dga' bar byed la /
analyzed: bya myos pa sgra 'byin pa nyams dga' bar byed pa dag na dga' bar byed la /
translated: In these forests and parks, the gods will enjoy themselves, reveling in the delightful sounds of the intoxicated birds.

original: kha cig ni shing ljon pa tshang tshing dag gi nang na khu byug dang / rma bya sgra snyan pa chags su rung ba 'byin pa rnams na lha mo dag dang lhan cig dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: kha cig ni shing ljon pa tshang tshing dag gi nang na khu byug dang / rma bya sgra snyan pa chags su rung ba 'byin pa rnams na lha mo dag dang lhan cig dga' bar byed do //
translated: Some, together with goddesses, enjoy themselves in the midst of dense groves of trees, where cuckoos and peacocks sing their lovely and captivating songs.

original: kha cig ni padma'i tshal sdong bu ni bee d'u rya /
analyzed: kha cig ni padma'i tshal sdong bu ni bee d'u rya /
translated: Some enjoy themselves in the midst of lotus ponds, whose stalks are of beryl,

original: 'dab ma ni gser /
analyzed: 'dab ma ni gser /
translated: whose leaves are of gold,

original: ze ba rdo rjer 'dug pa rnams kyi nang na dga' bar byed do //🔽kha cig ni rgun chang gi tshal rnams na 'bras bu nye phan gyis mos pa'i lha mo yul la rnam par chags pa rnams dang lhan cig rgun chang 'thung bar byed do //
analyzed: ze ba rdo rjer 'dug pa rnams kyi nang na dga' bar byed do // kha cig ni rgun chang gi tshal rnams na 'bras bu nye phan gyis mos pa'i lha mo yul la rnam par chags pa rnams dang lhan cig rgun chang 'thung bar byed do //
translated: and whose anthers are of diamond.🔽Some, together with goddesses who are attached to sensual pleasures, enjoy drinking palm wine in palm groves.

original: kha cig ni ri'i zom bee d'urya'i rdos gcal bkram pas rnam par phye ba'i sa phyogs rnams na dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: kha cig ni ri'i zom bee d'urya'i rdos gcal bkram pas rnam par phye ba'i sa phyogs rnams na dga' bar byed do //
translated: Some enjoy themselves in places whose ground is variegated with slabs of beryl.

original: kha cig ni ri'i zom mu men gyis gtams pa'i chu gtsang ma dri ma med pa 'bab pa'i chu bo rnams kyis nang na sdug pa dag dang lhan cig dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: kha cig ni ri'i zom mu men gyis gtams pa'i chu gtsang ma dri ma med pa 'bab pa'i chu bo rnams kyis nang na sdug pa dag dang lhan cig dga' bar byed do //
translated: Some, together with their beloveds, enjoy themselves in rivers that flow with pure, stainless water filled with sapphire jewels.

original: kha cig ni 'bab stegs dang / sa gzhi mu tig gi bye ma bdal ba dag na chu bsil la dang zhing gtsang ste dri ma med pa rnams kyi nang na dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: kha cig ni 'bab stegs dang / sa gzhi mu tig gi bye ma bdal ba dag na chu bsil la dang zhing gtsang ste dri ma med pa rnams kyi nang na dga' bar byed do //
translated: Some enjoy themselves in cool, clear, pure, stainless water on riverbanks and on ground spread with pearl sand.

original: kha cig ni rin po che sna bdun gyis brgyan pa'i yang thog nam mkha' la thug pa rnams kyi nang na dga' @152b bar byed do //
analyzed: kha cig ni rin po che sna bdun gyis brgyan pa'i yang thog nam mkha' la thug pa rnams kyi nang na dga' @152b bar byed do //
translated: Some enjoy themselves in palaces adorned with the seven precious substances and reaching to the sky.

original: kha cig ni lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor nas /
analyzed: kha cig ni lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor nas /
translated: Some, surrounded by groups of goddesses,

original: sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pas dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pas dga' bar byed do //
translated: enjoy themselves with the five types of musical instruments.

original: kha cig ni dpag bsam gyi shing ljon pa la dril bu g-yer ka'i sgra drag tu 'khrol bas mdzes pa rnams kyi nang na dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: kha cig ni dpag bsam gyi shing ljon pa la dril bu g-yer ka'i sgra drag tu 'khrol bas mdzes pa rnams kyi nang na dga' bar byed do //
translated: Some enjoy themselves in the midst of wish-fulfilling trees, beautiful with the sound of tinkling bells.

original: kha cig ni dus tshigs drug gi tshal shing ljon pa dag dang nye ba /
analyzed: kha cig ni dus tshigs drug gi tshal shing ljon pa dag dang nye ba /
translated: Some, in the midst of groves with trees of the six seasons,

original: rtag tu dga' ya yar gyur pa rnams kyi nang na snying du sdug cing 'dod pa rnams dang lhan cig dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: rtag tu dga' ya yar gyur pa rnams kyi nang na snying du sdug cing 'dod pa rnams dang lhan cig dga' bar byed do //
translated: always delighting in the company of their beloved and desired ones.🔽Some, having climbed to the top of a mountain peak,

original: kha cig sa phyogs gser btso mas brgyan pa dang / ri bo'i zom gyi steng du 'dzegs nas sa phyogs kyi chu bo rnams la'ang lta bar byed de /
analyzed: kha cig sa phyogs gser btso mas brgyan pa dang / ri bo'i zom gyi steng du 'dzegs nas sa phyogs kyi chu bo rnams la'ang lta bar byed de /
translated: admire the rivers in the land.

original: de ltar rang gi las kyis sprul pa lha'i bde ba dpe med pa rnam pa sna tshogs myong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar rang gi las kyis sprul pa lha'i bde ba dpe med pa rnam pa sna tshogs myong ngo //
translated: Thus, through their own karma, they experience the incomparable divine bliss emanated in various ways.

original: de ltar sred pa la rnam par chags pa'i lha rnams kyi mig gzugs dang / kha dog 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba rnam pa du ma dag gis chog mi shes so //
analyzed: de ltar sred pa la rnam par chags pa'i lha rnams kyi mig gzugs dang / kha dog 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba rnam pa du ma dag gis chog mi shes so //
translated: In this way, the eyes of the gods, attached to craving, are never satisfied with the many forms, colors, and attractive and delightful objects they desire.

original: rna ba'ang yul bde ba sgra snyan pa gsal ba yid du 'ong ba rnam pa du ma dag gis chog mi shes so //
analyzed: rna ba'ang yul bde ba sgra snyan pa gsal ba yid du 'ong ba rnam pa du ma dag gis chog mi shes so //
translated: Their ears are never satisfied with the many pleasant, clear, and delightful sounds that are the objects of their desire.

original: sna'ang yul bde ba dri zhim pa bsung che ba yid du 'ong ba rnam pa du ma dag gis chog mi shes so //
analyzed: sna'ang yul bde ba dri zhim pa bsung che ba yid du 'ong ba rnam pa du ma dag gis chog mi shes so //
translated: The nose is not satisfied with the many kinds of pleasant, fragrant, and delightful smells.

original: lce'ang yul bde ba ro zhim pa bro che ba yid du 'ong ba rnam pa du ma dag gis chog mi shes so //
analyzed: lce'ang yul bde ba ro zhim pa bro che ba yid du 'ong ba rnam pa du ma dag gis chog mi shes so //
translated: The tongue is not satisfied with the many kinds of pleasant, delicious, and delightful tastes.

original: lus kyang yul bde ba reg bya 'dod pa 'jam pa yid du 'ong ba rnam pa du ma dag gis chog mi shes so //
analyzed: lus kyang yul bde ba reg bya 'dod pa 'jam pa yid du 'ong ba rnam pa du ma dag gis chog mi shes so //
translated: The body is not satisfied with the many kinds of pleasant, soft, and delightful tactile objects.

original: yid kyang yul rnyog pa med pa 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba rnam pa du ma dag gis chog mi shes te /🔽de ltar dbang po drug @153a *//
analyzed: yid kyang yul rnyog pa med pa 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba rnam pa du ma dag gis chog mi shes te / de ltar dbang po drug @153a *//
translated: The mind is not satisfied with the many kinds of pleasant, delightful, and delightful mental objects.

original: gi yul la chags pa'i lha rnams chog mi shes pa yin no //
analyzed: gi yul la chags pa'i lha rnams chog mi shes pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the gods who are attached to the objects of the six senses are not satisfied.

original: ji ltar yul rnams kyis sreng pa spel ba de ltar 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar yul rnams kyis sreng pa spel ba de ltar 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: Just as they are burned by objects, so they increase and spread.

original: me 'bar ba bzhin la /
analyzed: me 'bar ba bzhin la /
translated: Like a blazing fire,

original: de yang yul gyi bde ba ji ltar dmigs pa de ltar rnam pa du mar 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang yul gyi bde ba ji ltar dmigs pa de ltar rnam pa du mar 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the objects of desire increase in many ways, just as they are perceived.

original: sred pa des bsgribs pa'i lha chog mi shes par gyur pa rnams shin tu bde ba'i mtha' dmigs su med de /
analyzed: sred pa des bsgribs pa'i lha chog mi shes par gyur pa rnams shin tu bde ba'i mtha' dmigs su med de /
translated: The gods who are obscured by such craving and who are insatiable will not be able to observe the end of their extreme happiness.

original: de ltar ji srid du 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba legs par byas pa'i las de zad par ma gyur pa de srid du /
analyzed: de ltar ji srid du 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba legs par byas pa'i las de zad par ma gyur pa de srid du /
translated: Thus, for as long as those karmic actions that were performed and accumulated do not come to an end,

original: lha'i bde ba dpe med pa rnam pa du ma myong ngo //
analyzed: lha'i bde ba dpe med pa rnam pa du ma myong ngo //
translated: they will experience the incomparable and manifold pleasures of the gods.

original: de phyis lha'i 'jig rten de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de phyis lha'i 'jig rten de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
translated: “Later, when they die and leave their divine world,

original: shi nas kyang rang gis byas pa'i las kyis sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shi nas kyang rang gis byas pa'i las kyis sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they will, due to their karmic actions, be born among hell beings, starving spirits, or animals.

original: gal te mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na /
analyzed: gal te mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na /
translated: If they are born with the general lot in life of humans,

original: de las de dang rgyu mthun par tshogs gcig tu spyod pa rgya mtsho'i tshong pa'am /🔽tshong rdal du gnas pa'am /
analyzed: de las de dang rgyu mthun par tshogs gcig tu spyod pa rgya mtsho'i tshong pa'am / tshong rdal du gnas pa'am /
translated: in accordance with their causal karmic actions, they will be merchants who travel the ocean,🔽they will live in a market town,

original: ri ba'i bar na gnas par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ri ba'i bar na gnas par 'gyur la /
translated: or they will live in a mountain valley.

original: gnyen che ba dang 'brel pa dang / rang dgar gnas pa dang / rgyal po la rag las par mi 'gyur ba dang / shin tu 'byor pa dang / rang dbang du 'gyur ba mthong ngo //🔽de nas dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
analyzed: gnyen che ba dang 'brel pa dang / rang dgar gnas pa dang / rgyal po la rag las par mi 'gyur ba dang / shin tu 'byor pa dang / rang dbang du 'gyur ba mthong ngo // de nas dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
translated: They will have great friends and relatives, they will be independent, they will not be dependent on the king, they will be very wealthy, and they will be independent.

original: lha pi wang can gsum pa'i gnas la rtog par byed de /
analyzed: lha pi wang can gsum pa'i gnas la rtog par byed de /
translated: “Next, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will examine the realm of the third class of the Veṇupana gods.

original: de thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas lha de rnams kyi gnas @153b skyil mo krung gi steng du skye zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: de thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas lha de rnams kyi gnas @153b skyil mo krung gi steng du skye zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then notice that the gods in that realm are born in a place called Above Crossed Legs.

original: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: Wondering what karmic actions cause beings to be born there, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing.

original: snying rje dam pa dang ldan pa gang gi sems can chus khyer ba'am /
analyzed: snying rje dam pa dang ldan pa gang gi sems can chus khyer ba'am /
translated: He will then notice that some people who are endowed with the highest compassion may rescue beings who are being carried away by water,

original: lo nyes byung nas ltogs te srog chad la thug pa la byams pas brlan pa'i yid kyis bu bzhin skyong bar byed cing dgos pa med kyang sems pas bsgoms pa'i snying kho nas yang dag par bskyabs na /
analyzed: lo nyes byung nas ltogs te srog chad la thug pa la byams pas brlan pa'i yid kyis bu bzhin skyong bar byed cing dgos pa med kyang sems pas bsgoms pa'i snying kho nas yang dag par bskyabs na /
translated: When a famine occurs and people are starving and on the verge of death, he protects them with a mind moistened by loving kindness, caring for them as if they were his own children.

original: de lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten skyil mo krung du gnas pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du rdzus te skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten skyil mo krung du gnas pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du rdzus te skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When he has died and departed from that realm, he will be reborn among the gods who dwell in the Crossed-Legged Realm in the happy realms of the higher existence.

original: de na lha dang / lha mo gnas la /
analyzed: de na lha dang / lha mo gnas la /
translated: There, he will dwell with the gods and goddesses.

original: lha gzhan yang phyogs gzhan na lhan cig nye bar gnas te /
analyzed: lha gzhan yang phyogs gzhan na lhan cig nye bar gnas te /
translated: Other gods will also be present in other places.

original: lha'i bu de lha'i skyil mo krung bcas pa'i steng du skyes so //
analyzed: lha'i bu de lha'i skyil mo krung bcas pa'i steng du skyes so //
translated: The god will be born on the lap of a god who is sitting cross-legged.

original: de la lha de bu'i blo skye la lha mo de'ang de bzhin du bu'i blo skye'o //
analyzed: de la lha de bu'i blo skye la lha mo de'ang de bzhin du bu'i blo skye'o //
translated: The god will think, “This is my son,” and the goddess will think, “This is my son.”

translated: “The monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will then continue to examine the realm of the gods of the third level of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

analyzed: de thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /

analyzed: lha pi wang can gsum pa'i gnas spyod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //

analyzed: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /

analyzed: legs par byas pa'i las ji ltar yod pa bzhin spyod pa /

original: sems can dga' 'dzings te 'thab pa'am /
analyzed: sems can dga' 'dzings te 'thab pa'am /
translated: who are caught up in quarrels and fights,

original: tshal khung stug po'i nang du song nas /
analyzed: tshal khung stug po'i nang du song nas /

analyzed: srog la the tshom za ba 'chi ba la thug pa dag thar par byas shing /
translated: and then free those who are in danger of losing their lives and are about to die,

original: sems can la phan pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / shin tu bsdams pa dang / lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi tshul khrims spyod na /
analyzed: sems can la phan pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / shin tu bsdams pa dang / lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi tshul khrims spyod na /
translated: who have a mind that benefits beings, who are very restrained, and who practice physical, verbal, and mental discipline,

original: de lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten spyod pa dang ldan par gnas pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten spyod pa dang ldan par gnas pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: will, upon separating from their bodies, go to the joyful higher realms and be born among the gods in the realm of the gods who enjoy creating.🔽“

analyzed: der skyes nas kyang zla ba'i 'od dang mtshungs pa de kun nas gzi brjid ni 'bar /
translated: Once born there, they are like the light of the moon and their splendor blazes.

original: dbang po dul ba'i bde ba dang ni ldan /
analyzed: dbang po dul ba'i bde ba dang ni ldan /
translated: They are endowed with the bliss of having their senses under control.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams kyis nyin gcig bzhin du ni rtse /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams kyis nyin gcig bzhin du ni rtse /
translated: They enjoy themselves every day with the five sense pleasures.

original: lha mo'i tshogs du ma dang ni nye bar spyod /
analyzed: lha mo'i tshogs du ma dang ni nye bar spyod /
translated: They enjoy themselves with many groups of goddesses.

original: lha'i phreng ba dang / gos ni gyon /
analyzed: lha'i phreng ba dang / gos ni gyon /

original: yang dang / yang du 'jo sgeg ni byed /
analyzed: yang dang / yang du 'jo sgeg ni byed /

original: tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal dang / 'bab chu'i dngo mang po rnams su ni rtse ste /🔽de ltar de rtse ba na shel gyi tshal zhes bya ba @157a *//
analyzed: tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal dang / 'bab chu'i dngo mang po rnams su ni rtse ste / de ltar de rtse ba na shel gyi tshal zhes bya ba @157a *//

original: der 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: der 'gro bar byed do //
translated: “ ‘As they enjoy themselves in this way, they will go to a forest known as Crystal Forest.

analyzed: tshal de na shel gyi shing ljon pa thams cad kyis kun nas gsal ba yin la shing ljon pa me tog dang / 'bras bus khebs pa de dag gis me tog dang / lo ma phun sum tshogs pa rnams kyang ji ltar lhang tsher ltar gsal ba'am /
translated: In that forest, all the trees are made of crystal and are covered with flowers and fruits. The trees are so clear that they are like mirrors,

original: me long ltar gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: me long ltar gsal ba yin no //
translated: It is clear like a mirror.

original: 'bras bu rnams kyang gru bzhi dang / zlum por skyes te /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnams kyang gru bzhi dang / zlum por skyes te /

original: me long bzhin du gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: me long bzhin du gsal ba yin no //
translated: clear like a mirror.

analyzed: de nas lha de gang gi tshe tshal de'i nang du zhugs pa dang / de'i tshe rang gi lus kyi gzugs brnyan 'brum snyed 'byung ba mthong ngo //

analyzed: des gzugs brnyan shin tu rgya che ba me tog phreng ba dang / byug pas rnam par brgyan pa phun sum tshogs pa de dag mthong nas de brgya 'gyur du dregs pa skye ste /
translated: Seeing those extremely vast reflections, adorned with garlands and ointments, perfect in every way, he becomes a hundred times more arrogant.

original: kye; ae ma bdag gi gzugs brnyan rnam pa ji snyed 'byung ba 'di dag lha gzhan rnams la rnam pa de lta bu mi 'byung ngo snyam mo //
analyzed: kye; ae ma bdag gi gzugs brnyan rnam pa ji snyed 'byung ba 'di dag lha gzhan rnams la rnam pa de lta bu mi 'byung ngo snyam mo //
translated: “Ah! How many of my reflections appear! Such reflections do not appear for other gods.”

original: 'jig rten skyong ba mig mi bzang de tshal de'i nang du zhugs nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten skyong ba mig mi bzang de tshal de'i nang du zhugs nas /
translated: The world protector Virūḍhaka enters the grove

original: 'jig rten gyi bya ba dag la rtog par byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi bya ba dag la rtog par byed do //
translated: and considers worldly affairs.

original: tshal de'i mthu ni 'di lta bu yin te /
analyzed: tshal de'i mthu ni 'di lta bu yin te /
translated: The power of the grove is such that

analyzed: gal te sa dang / bar snang la rgyu ba'i gnod sbyin dag gis dzambu'i gling gi sems can rnams kyi dbang gi 'bras bus chos dang / chos ma yin pa byas pa de dag rings par ma sbran na /
translated: If the yakṣas who live in the earth and the sky do not quickly inform the king of the results of the power of the actions of the beings of Jambudvīpa, whether they are in accordance with the Dharma or not,

original: ji ltar mi chos dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: ji ltar mi chos dang ldan pa'am /
translated: then the king will not know whether the people are acting in accordance with the Dharma or not.

original: mi chos dang mi ldan pa byung ba de ltar shel gyi shing ljon @157b pa rnams kyi tshal de'i nang du mthong la /
analyzed: mi chos dang mi ldan pa byung ba de ltar shel gyi shing ljon @157b pa rnams kyi tshal de'i nang du mthong la /
translated: In that way, the king will see in the interior of the forest of crystal trees whether the people are acting in accordance with the Dharma or not.

original: phyis gnod sbyin dag rgyal po chen po la mi'i bya ba'i rnam pa sbron par byed do //
analyzed: phyis gnod sbyin dag rgyal po chen po la mi'i bya ba'i rnam pa sbron par byed do //
translated: Later, the yakṣas will inform the great king of the actions of the people.

original: de nas mig mi bzang de mir gtogs pa'i chos ma yin pa byas pa thams cad mthong nas tshal de la mgu'o //
analyzed: de nas mig mi bzang de mir gtogs pa'i chos ma yin pa byas pa thams cad mthong nas tshal de la mgu'o //
translated: Then Virūḍhaka, having seen all the actions of the people that are not in accordance with the Dharma, will be displeased with the forest.

original: gal te mi chos dang mi ldan zhing chos kyi rjes su mi 'jug pa dag byung na /
analyzed: gal te mi chos dang mi ldan zhing chos kyi rjes su mi 'jug pa dag byung na /

analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dag de bzhin du brgya byin la sbron par byed do //
translated: then the good and the bad will be reported to Śakra in the same way.

original: de ltar tshal de'i mthu mthong nas /
analyzed: de ltar tshal de'i mthu mthong nas /
translated: In this way, having seen the power of the forest,

original: de nas lha de tshal de na gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya 'dod pa sna tshogs kyis myos te ji srid du 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba byas shing bsags pa'i las de zad par ma gyur pa de srid du de na dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: de nas lha de tshal de na gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya 'dod pa sna tshogs kyis myos te ji srid du 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba byas shing bsags pa'i las de zad par ma gyur pa de srid du de na dga' bar byed do //
translated: Then, in that forest, the god becomes intoxicated by the various desirable forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and textures. He enjoys himself until finally his completed and accumulated desirable, attractive, and delightful actions are exhausted.

original: de phyis lha'i 'jig rten de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de phyis lha'i 'jig rten de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then, after he dies and leaves that divine world,

analyzed: shi nas kyang las nye bar 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin 'khor ba na sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: he will wander in cyclic existence due to his actions, taking birth among hell beings, starving spirits, and animals.

original: gal te mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na /
analyzed: gal te mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na /
translated: If he is born with the general lot in life of a human,

analyzed: de las de dang rgyu mthun par rtag tu yang dag pa'i lta ba dang ldan la /

analyzed: chos kyi gnas la 'byor cing 'grub pa chen por 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
translated: He will be wealthy and successful in a place where the Dharma is practiced.

analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
translated: Next, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karma

analyzed: lha pi wang can gsum pa'i gnas la rtog par byed de /
translated: examines the realm of the gods of the Triple-Ghanta.

original: des de dag gi gnas gzhan bcu gcig pa ni ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: des de dag gi gnas gzhan bcu gcig pa ni ma mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see an eleventh realm.

original: rgyal chen @158a *//
analyzed: rgyal chen @158a *//
translated: The gods of the Four Great Kings

analyzed: bzhi'i lha rnams kyi gnas rnam pa bzhi po kun tu rgyu zhes bya ba kho nar zad de /
translated: have only four types of realms called the Cāturmahārājakāyikas.

analyzed: gang de dag ni ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi ngos la 'khor ro //
translated: They circle around the slopes of Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains.

analyzed: gzhal med khang dang ldan pa'i lha gang yin pa de dag la mu stegs pa gzhan dag gza' dang / skar ma dang / rgyu skar dag yin par 'du shes te /

analyzed: de rnams kyi rags pa bgrangs na bye ba phrag sum cu rtsa drug yod do //

analyzed: de nas las gang gis der skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /

analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: Examining that with knowledge derived from hearing, he sees this:

analyzed: der yang lus dang / ngag gi tshul khrims bdun po rnam pa sna tshogs kyis der skye'o //
translated: There, too, one is born through various kinds of physical and verbal discipline.

original: de la lus kyi rnam pa gsum dang / ngag gi rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la lus kyi rnam pa gsum dang / ngag gi rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are three kinds of physical and four kinds of verbal.

original: mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief,

analyzed: sems can rnams las kyi dbang gi 'bras bu rnam pa du mas der skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: sentient beings are born there through the power of various actions.

analyzed: de'i phyir sems can rnams kyi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba byas pa'i rkyen gyi bye brag gis shes par byed de /
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the conditions for the virtuous and non-virtuous actions of sentient beings are different.

analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba de'ang lha kun tu rgyu ba de rnams ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi ngos la 'khor ba'i sar 'khor bar byed de /
translated: The sun and moon, too, are the celestial bodies that move around the gods, circling the face of Mount Sumeru.

original: rlung 'khor los bskor ba zhes bya ba gang gis byas pa des /
analyzed: rlung 'khor los bskor ba zhes bya ba gang gis byas pa des /
translated: There is a wind called Wheel-turning that causes

analyzed: lha de dag thams cad ri'i rgyal po ri rab de la 'khor bar byed do //
translated: all those gods to circle Mount Sumeru.

analyzed: de dag gi bar yangs pa na 'jig rten skyong ba dang / ku be ra gnyis gnas te /
translated: Between them, the two Lokapalas and Kubera reside.

analyzed: lha de rnams rgyal po chen po de @158b dag dang lhan cig gling bzhi rnams su kun tu rgyu'o //
translated: Together with the great kings, these gods travel throughout the four continents.

original: nor bu sngon po dang / ser po dang / ljang gu sna tshogs kyi gzhal med khang rnams kyi nang na snga ma bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: nor bu sngon po dang / ser po dang / ljang gu sna tshogs kyi gzhal med khang rnams kyi nang na snga ma bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In palaces of various blue, yellow, and green jewels, they enjoy themselves as described before.

original: de dag ji srid du 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba byas shing bsags pa'i las de zad par ma gyur pa de srid du /
analyzed: de dag ji srid du 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba byas shing bsags pa'i las de zad par ma gyur pa de srid du /
translated: As long as the previously accumulated and stored karma of desirable, attractive, and delightful actions has not been exhausted,

analyzed: kun tu rgyu ba de dag ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga ji ltar 'dod pa rnams kyis dga' bar byed do //
translated: they will continue to enjoy the five sense pleasures as they wish.
