analyzed: de'i las zad nas de nas yang las nye bar 'gro ba ji ltar ba bzhin sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When their karma is exhausted, they will again be born among hell beings, starving spirits, and animals, in accordance with their karmic actions.

original: gal te mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam pa mi'i nang du skyes na /
analyzed: gal te mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam pa mi'i nang du skyes na /
translated: If they are born with the general lot in life of a human,

original: de las de dang rgyu mthun par rtag tu yul nas yul du 'gro ba'i nang du 'gyur te /🔽'di ltar tshul khrims kyi rgyu des bde yang rung /
analyzed: de las de dang rgyu mthun par rtag tu yul nas yul du 'gro ba'i nang du 'gyur te / 'di ltar tshul khrims kyi rgyu des bde yang rung /
translated: In accordance with their causal actions, they will constantly travel from one country to another.

original: mi bde yang rung /
analyzed: mi bde yang rung /
translated: Whether they are happy or unhappy,

original: glo bur du yul gzhan kun tu 'gro bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo //🔽de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
analyzed: glo bur du yul gzhan kun tu 'gro bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo // de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
translated: they will suddenly travel to other countries due to the causes of their discipline.

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams la rtogs par byed de /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams la rtogs par byed de / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: “Next, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will examine the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings.

original: gnas skabs gzhan gcig kyang shes par ma nus la /
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan gcig kyang shes par ma nus la /
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then notice that they are unable to understand any other situation,

original: gnas skabs gzhan gcig kyang mthong bar ma gyur nas /🔽de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan gcig kyang mthong bar ma gyur nas / de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: and that they are unable to see any other situation.

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams ni mtha' yas te /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams ni mtha' yas te /
translated: He will think, ‘The gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings are infinite.

original: de ltar mtha' med do snyam mo //🔽rang gi las kyis ri rab la tshal dang / nye ba'i @159a *//
analyzed: de ltar mtha' med do snyam mo // rang gi las kyis ri rab la tshal dang / nye ba'i @159a *//
translated: They are limitless.’

original: tshal bzhi dag tu dga' bar byed cing skor bar byed do //
analyzed: tshal bzhi dag tu dga' bar byed cing skor bar byed do //
translated: Due to their own karmic actions, they will enjoy themselves and roam about in the four forests and parks on Mount Sumeru.

original: ri rab kyi ngos gang la nyi ma 'khor ba'i ngos de dang / des mi'i gnas gang du ri rab kyi grib ma de 'bab ste /
analyzed: ri rab kyi ngos gang la nyi ma 'khor ba'i ngos de dang / des mi'i gnas gang du ri rab kyi grib ma de 'bab ste /
translated: The side of Meru where the sun moves is the side where the shadow of Meru falls on the land of humans.

original: de ltar de dzambu'i gling du mtshan mor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar de dzambu'i gling du mtshan mor 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, it is night in Jambudvīpa.

original: byang phyogs na rlung 'khor lo'i gzugs zhes bya ba yongs su 'khor zhing /🔽des byang phyogs kyi skar ma gang yin pa de dag thams cad 'char du mi ster la /
analyzed: byang phyogs na rlung 'khor lo'i gzugs zhes bya ba yongs su 'khor zhing / des byang phyogs kyi skar ma gang yin pa de dag thams cad 'char du mi ster la /
translated: In the north, there is a wind called Cakravarta.

original: nub tu yang mi ster te /
analyzed: nub tu yang mi ster te /
translated: It does not allow the stars that are in the north to rise or set.

original: de ltar rlung gi dbang gis phyogs su 'khor zhing 'dug go /
analyzed: de ltar rlung gi dbang gis phyogs su 'khor zhing 'dug go /
translated: In this way, the stars are held in place by the power of the wind.

original: mu stegs pa gzhan de nyid ma mthong zhing skar ma'i dpyad mngon par mi shes la phyogs gcig tu lta ba'i mu stegs pa de dag gis mthong nas /
analyzed: mu stegs pa gzhan de nyid ma mthong zhing skar ma'i dpyad mngon par mi shes la phyogs gcig tu lta ba'i mu stegs pa de dag gis mthong nas /
translated: Other tīrthikas, who do not see reality and do not understand the science of the stars, see this and say,

original: 'di ltar de ni chu srin byis pa gsod yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni chu srin byis pa gsod yin te /
translated: “This is Makara, the killer of children.

original: nub tu mi ster la /
analyzed: nub tu mi ster la /
translated: It does not allow the stars to rise or set.

original: drang srong bdun dag gi 'jig rten 'dzin to snyam mo //
analyzed: drang srong bdun dag gi 'jig rten 'dzin to snyam mo //
translated: It holds the world of the seven sages.”

original: de ltar des rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams ma lus par mthong zhing sa dang bcas pa la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong nas 'khor ba la yid byung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar des rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams ma lus par mthong zhing sa dang bcas pa la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong nas 'khor ba la yid byung ngo //
translated: In this way, he sees all the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings and, seeing them as they truly are, together with the ground, he becomes disenchanted with cyclic existence.

original: de ltar de dag mthong nas lha rnams kyi ltung ba'i sdug bsngal mngon par rtogs nas yid byung ste /🔽'khor ba na gnas su rung brtag pa'am /🔽brtan pa'am / ther zug pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar de dag mthong nas lha rnams kyi ltung ba'i sdug bsngal mngon par rtogs nas yid byung ste / 'khor ba na gnas su rung brtag pa'am / brtan pa'am / ther zug pa'am /
translated: Having seen this, he realizes the suffering of the gods’ downfall and becomes disenchanted.🔽There is nothing in cyclic existence that is suitable to rely on,🔽nothing that is stable, permanent,

original: mi 'gyur ba'i chos can gang yang med la /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'i chos can gang yang med la /
translated: or unchanging.

original: 'du ba dang / 'bral ba'i bgo skal la spyod pa /🔽las kyi bgo skal la spyod pa /
analyzed: 'du ba dang / 'bral ba'i bgo skal la spyod pa / las kyi bgo skal la spyod pa /
translated: Everyone experiences the separation that comes from being together,

original: las kyi skye gnas pa /
analyzed: las kyi skye gnas pa /
translated: the separation that comes from being together is experienced by all,🔽and everyone experiences the separation that comes from being born.

original: las la rton par @159b mi byed pa med de /
analyzed: las la rton par @159b mi byed pa med de /
translated: There is no one who does not rely on karma.

original: de ltar dge slong des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags so //
analyzed: de ltar dge slong des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags so //
translated: In this way, the monk examines things with knowledge derived from hearing.

original: de nas yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
analyzed: de nas yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
translated: Next, the spiritual practitioner who carefully observes inner phenomena will think, ‘What is the cause and condition for the gods’ downfall?

original: de ltar dge slong de byis pa so so'i skye bo kun gang la dga' ba de la rag las par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar dge slong de byis pa so so'i skye bo kun gang la dga' ba de la rag las par 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, the monk is dependent on whatever delights all ordinary, childish beings.

original: sred pa'i rgyu bskyed pa de dag 'di ltar bdag cag mtho ris su skye bar 'gyur zhing der bdag cag bde bar gyur cig snyam nas tshangs par spyad pa spyod do //
analyzed: sred pa'i rgyu bskyed pa de dag 'di ltar bdag cag mtho ris su skye bar 'gyur zhing der bdag cag bde bar gyur cig snyam nas tshangs par spyad pa spyod do //
translated: “ ‘Those who give rise to the causes of craving practice pure conduct, thinking, “May we be born in the higher realms and may we be happy there.”

original: de ltar spyod pa de la'ang dge slong de lha'i bde ba rnam pa gzhan dag la'ang dmigs shing thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas mthong nas dga' bar mi byed /
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa de la'ang dge slong de lha'i bde ba rnam pa gzhan dag la'ang dmigs shing thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas mthong nas dga' bar mi byed /
translated: “ ‘The monk who practices in this way, seeing and observing the other types of divine happiness through knowledge derived from hearing, does not delight in them.

original: chags par mi byed /
analyzed: chags par mi byed /
translated: He is not attached to them.

original: ro myong bar mi byed /
analyzed: ro myong bar mi byed /
translated: He does not savor them.

original: bdud dang lhan cig 'gyed par nus shing 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las rgal ba'i bsam pa can yin te /
analyzed: bdud dang lhan cig 'gyed par nus shing 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las rgal ba'i bsam pa can yin te /
translated: He is able to fight with the māras and has the intention to cross the ocean of cyclic existence.

original: de ltar dge slong des sa gzhan bcu bdun pa la zhugs so //
analyzed: de ltar dge slong des sa gzhan bcu bdun pa la zhugs so //
translated: In this way, the monk has entered the seventeenth ground.

original: sa bla'i gnod sbyin dag gis de thos nas dga' ste /
analyzed: sa bla'i gnod sbyin dag gis de thos nas dga' ste /
translated: “ ‘When the terrestrial yakṣas hear this, they will be delighted.

original: bar snang la spyod pa'i gnod sbyin rnams la mngon par bsnyad do //🔽de gang gis kyang rgyal chen bzhi pa rnams la bsnyad la /
analyzed: bar snang la spyod pa'i gnod sbyin rnams la mngon par bsnyad do // de gang gis kyang rgyal chen bzhi pa rnams la bsnyad la /
translated: The yakṣas who move in space announce it to the Four Great Kings.

original: snga ma bzhin tshad med 'od kyi lha rnams kyi bar la gcig nas gcig tu bsnyad do //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin tshad med 'od kyi lha rnams kyi bar la gcig nas gcig tu bsnyad do //
translated: From there, it is announced to the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings, and so on, up to the Heaven of the Gods of Limitless Light.

original: 'di ltar lha dag /
analyzed: 'di ltar lha dag /
translated: The gods say:

original: dzambu'i gling na rigs kyi bu grong che ge mo zhig dang / grong rdal mang ge mo zhig dang / rigs ga ge mo zhig dang / yul che ge mo zhig nas mi mang ge mo zhes bya ba skra dang / kha spu bregs nas gos dur smrig bgos te /
analyzed: dzambu'i gling na rigs kyi bu grong che ge mo zhig dang / grong rdal mang ge mo zhig dang / rigs ga ge mo zhig dang / yul che ge mo zhig nas mi mang ge mo zhes bya ba skra dang / kha spu bregs nas gos dur smrig bgos te /
translated: “In Jambudvīpa, a son of noble family, named so-and-so, from such-and-such a village, from such-and-such a town, from such-and-such a family, from such-and-such a country, has shaved off his hair and beard, put on the orange robes,

original: @160a *// dad pas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung ngo //
analyzed: @160a *// dad pas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung ngo //
translated: and with faith has gone forth from home to homelessness.

original: dge slong de bdud dang lhan cig 'gyed par 'bad cing brtson la srid pas nyam nga ba las rgal ba'i bsam pa yod do //
analyzed: dge slong de bdud dang lhan cig 'gyed par 'bad cing brtson la srid pas nyam nga ba las rgal ba'i bsam pa yod do //
translated: That monk is striving and persevering in debate with Māra, and he has the intention to cross over the terrors of existence.

original: de ltar tshad med 'od kyi lha rnams kyas thos nas yid mchog tu dga' zhing de dag la /
analyzed: de ltar tshad med 'od kyi lha rnams kyas thos nas yid mchog tu dga' zhing de dag la /
translated: When the gods of the Heaven of Limitless Light hear this, they are overjoyed and say:

original: lha; bdag ni dga' ste /
analyzed: lha; bdag ni dga' ste /
translated: “The gods will say, ‘We are delighted!

original: gang mi'i 'jig rten du mi chos dang ldan zhing chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa dag nges par 'byung la /🔽ye shes rtsom pa goms par byed /
analyzed: gang mi'i 'jig rten du mi chos dang ldan zhing chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa dag nges par 'byung la / ye shes rtsom pa goms par byed /
translated: Those who in the human world are righteous and follow the Dharma will certainly attain liberation.🔽They will cultivate the practice of wisdom,

original: yongs su spyod par byed /🔽bdud dang lhan cig 'gyed par byed de /
analyzed: yongs su spyod par byed / bdud dang lhan cig 'gyed par byed de /
translated: they will enjoy it,🔽and they will fight with Māra.

original: bdud kyi phyogs ni dma'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi phyogs ni dma'o //
translated: The side of Māra will be low,

original: dam pa'i chos kyi phyogs ni mtho'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi phyogs ni mtho'o //
translated: while the side of the Dharma will be high.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis bshad pa'i dam pa'i chos ni 'phel lo zhes lha de dag bsnyad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis bshad pa'i dam pa'i chos ni 'phel lo zhes lha de dag bsnyad do //
translated: The Dharma taught by the buddhas will flourish.’

original: de nas yang dge slong de tshul khrims la rab tu rnam par spyod par byed de /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong de tshul khrims la rab tu rnam par spyod par byed de /
translated: “Next, the monk will examine discipline in detail:

original: tshul khrims med pa'am /
analyzed: tshul khrims med pa'am /
translated: ‘Without discipline,

original: shes pa med pa ni mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lhar skye ba med do snyam nas /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: shes pa med pa ni mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lhar skye ba med do snyam nas / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: or without knowledge, one cannot be born as a god in the higher realms.’

original: tshul khrims tsam gyis ni mtho ris su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims tsam gyis ni mtho ris su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing, he will then examine the matter and understand that one can be born in the higher realms through discipline alone.

original: sbyin pas ni der skye bar mi 'gyur zhing longs spyod shin tu che bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: sbyin pas ni der skye bar mi 'gyur zhing longs spyod shin tu che bar 'gyur la /
translated: Generosity does not cause rebirth there, but it does cause one to have abundant resources.

original: shes pas ni de nas shi nas ngan song du 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pas ni de nas shi nas ngan song du 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Knowledge prevents one from going to the lower realms after death.

original: de la tshul khrims gang dang / rnam pa dus lha'i 'jig rten gang du skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
analyzed: de la tshul khrims gang dang / rnam pa dus lha'i 'jig rten gang du skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
translated: What are the moral disciplines and in what realms do they cause rebirth?

original: des brtags na tshul khrims rnam pa bdun gyis lha'i ris drug rnams kyi nang du tha ma dang / @160b 'bring dang / mchog tu skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des brtags na tshul khrims rnam pa bdun gyis lha'i ris drug rnams kyi nang du tha ma dang / @160b 'bring dang / mchog tu skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: He sees that the seven types of moral discipline cause rebirth in the six divine realms as the lowest, middling, and highest.

original: srog gcod pa spangs pa'i tshul khrims kyis rgyal chen bzhi pa rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog gcod pa spangs pa'i tshul khrims kyis rgyal chen bzhi pa rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The moral discipline of abandoning killing causes rebirth among the Caturmaharajakas.

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa spangs pas sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa spangs pas sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The moral discipline of abandoning killing and stealing causes rebirth among the Thirty-three.

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa spangs pas 'thab bral ba rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa spangs pas 'thab bral ba rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By abandoning killing, stealing, and sexual misconduct, one is reborn among the gods of the Yāma Heaven.

original: sdom pa blangs te srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa spangs shing rdzun dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / ngag kyal pa spangs pas dga' ldan pa rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdom pa blangs te srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa spangs shing rdzun dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / ngag kyal pa spangs pas dga' ldan pa rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By taking the vow and abandoning killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, slander, harsh speech, and idle talk, one is reborn among the gods of Tuṣita Heaven.

original: 'jig rten pa'i sdom pa blangs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i sdom pa blangs te /
translated: By taking the worldly vow

original: sangs rgyas 'ba' zhig la dad la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'ba' zhig la dad la /
translated: and having faith in the Buddha alone,

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / rdzun dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po spangs pas 'phrul dga' ba rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / rdzun dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po spangs pas 'phrul dga' ba rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: by abandoning killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, and slander, one is reborn among the gods of Nirmāṇarati Heaven.

original: de bzhin du srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / rdzun dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / ngag kyal pa spangs pas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams yi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / rdzun dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / ngag kyal pa spangs pas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams yi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, by abandoning killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, slander, harsh speech, and idle talk, one will be born among the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods.

original: de ltar dge slong de las dang / tshul khrims su 'brel ba rnams lha'i 'jig rten du skye bar rjes su sems te /
analyzed: de ltar dge slong de las dang / tshul khrims su 'brel ba rnams lha'i 'jig rten du skye bar rjes su sems te /
translated: “Thus, the monk will contemplate how actions and discipline lead to birth in the world of the gods.

original: sdom pa blangs pa'i gang zag @161a *//
analyzed: sdom pa blangs pa'i gang zag @161a *//
translated: “What kind of person who has taken vows

original: gang du ji ltar skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
analyzed: gang du ji ltar skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
translated: will be born where and how?”

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags nas /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags nas /
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing, he will then examine this question.

original: srog gcod pa spangs pa'i sdom pa blangs pa ni de rgyal chen bzhi pa rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: srog gcod pa spangs pa'i sdom pa blangs pa ni de rgyal chen bzhi pa rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: “Those who have taken the vow to abandon killing will be born among the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings.

original: srog gcod pa spangs pa sdom pas /
analyzed: srog gcod pa spangs pa sdom pas /
translated: “The vow to abandon killing

original: bong tshod dang / brtson 'grus dang / kha dog dang / dbang phyug dang / tshe dag ches ring bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bong tshod dang / brtson 'grus dang / kha dog dang / dbang phyug dang / tshe dag ches ring bar 'gyur ro //
translated: their size, their diligence, their complexion, their power, and their lifespan are all superior.

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dag spangs pa'i sdom pa blangs pa ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dag spangs pa'i sdom pa blangs pa ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Those who take up the vow to abandon taking life and taking what is not given are born among the Thirty-Three Gods.

original: spangs pa de dag pas bong tshod dang / brtson 'grus dang / spro ba dang / gzugs dang / stobs dang / dbang phyug dang / tshe dag mchog tu ring bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spangs pa de dag pas bong tshod dang / brtson 'grus dang / spro ba dang / gzugs dang / stobs dang / dbang phyug dang / tshe dag mchog tu ring bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Their size, diligence, enthusiasm, form, strength, power, and lifespan are all superior to those who do not abandon these actions.

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa spangs pa kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas 'thab bral ba rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa spangs pa kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas 'thab bral ba rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Those who rely on, become habituated to, and increase the practice of abandoning taking life, taking what is not given, and sexual misconduct are born among the gods of the Yāma Heaven.

original: spangs pa de dag pas bong tshod dang / kha dog dang / dbang phyug dang / tshe dang / gzugs la sogs pa ches bzang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spangs pa de dag pas bong tshod dang / kha dog dang / dbang phyug dang / tshe dang / gzugs la sogs pa ches bzang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Their size, complexion, power, lifespan, form, and so forth are all superior to those who do not abandon these actions.

original: dga' ldan pa rnams kyi nang du sems dang / shes pa gnyis kyi khyad par gyis bong tshod dang / kha dog dang / dbang phyug dang / dad pa dang / bde ba khyad par can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dga' ldan pa rnams kyi nang du sems dang / shes pa gnyis kyi khyad par gyis bong tshod dang / kha dog dang / dbang phyug dang / dad pa dang / bde ba khyad par can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Among the Tuṣita gods, there is a difference in size, color, power, faith, and special happiness due to the difference between mind and consciousness.

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin @161b par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / rdzun dang / phra ma spangs pa'i sdom pa la gnas pa ni 'phrul dga' ba rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin @161b par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / rdzun dang / phra ma spangs pa'i sdom pa la gnas pa ni 'phrul dga' ba rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Those who abide in the vow of abandoning killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, and slander are reborn among the Nirmāṇarati gods.

original: spangs pa de dag pas de bong tshod dang / dbang phyug dang / bde ba dang / tshe ring ba dag ches mchog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spangs pa de dag pas de bong tshod dang / dbang phyug dang / bde ba dang / tshe ring ba dag ches mchog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Due to those abandonments, their size, power, happiness, and lifespan become even more supreme.

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / rdzun dang / phra ma dang / tshig kyal pa spangs pa'i sdom pa la gnas pa ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / rdzun dang / phra ma dang / tshig kyal pa spangs pa'i sdom pa la gnas pa ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Those who abide in the vow of abandoning killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, slander, and idle speech are reborn among the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods.

original: spangs pa de dag pas de bong tshod dang / dbang phyug dang / bde ba dang / mthu dang / gzugs dang / tshe dag ches lhag par 'gyur zhing bdud sdig can gyi tshig nyan par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: spangs pa de dag pas de bong tshod dang / dbang phyug dang / bde ba dang / mthu dang / gzugs dang / tshe dag ches lhag par 'gyur zhing bdud sdig can gyi tshig nyan par mi 'gyur la /
translated: They will have greater size, power, happiness, strength, beauty, and longevity than those who have abandoned the afflictions. They will not listen to the words of the evil Māra,

original: de des thub par mi 'gyur ba mthong ngo //🔽de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
analyzed: de des thub par mi 'gyur ba mthong ngo // de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
translated: and they will not be overpowered by him.

original: tshul khrims mtho ris su skye bo'i sa bon du ji ltar 'gyur snyam nas shin tu zhib mor dpyod de /
analyzed: tshul khrims mtho ris su skye bo'i sa bon du ji ltar 'gyur snyam nas shin tu zhib mor dpyod de /
translated: “The monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will then continue to examine how discipline is the seed for taking birth in the higher realms.

original: des brtags na sems dang / sems las byung ba chen pos tshul khrims chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen por 'gyur /
analyzed: des brtags na sems dang / sems las byung ba chen pos tshul khrims chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen por 'gyur /
translated: He will examine this in great detail and thus come to understand that the great mind and mental factors give rise to lesser, intermediate, and greater forms of discipline.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha drug rnams kyi nang du sems kyi khyad par gyis sems las byung ba khyad par du 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha drug rnams kyi nang du sems kyi khyad par gyis sems las byung ba khyad par du 'gyur la /
translated: The differences in the mind give rise to differences in the mental factors, and thus the gods in the six realms of the desire realm will experience different results.

original: sems las byung ba'i tshul khrims kyi khyad par gyis skye ba khyad par du 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i tshul khrims kyi khyad par gyis skye ba khyad par du 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
translated: He sees that the differences in rebirth are due to the differences in the morality of the mind.

original: de nas yang dge slong de tshul khrims la dpyod par @162a *//🔽byed de / tshul khrims rnam pa du yod snyam nas des brtags na /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong de tshul khrims la dpyod par @162a *// byed de / tshul khrims rnam pa du yod snyam nas des brtags na /
translated: Then the monk investigates morality further:🔽“How many kinds of morality are there?”

original: tshul khrims rnam pa gnyis te /🔽'jig rten pa lhan cig skyes pa dang / 'du ba byas pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam pa gnyis te / 'jig rten pa lhan cig skyes pa dang / 'du ba byas pa'o //
translated: He examines and sees that there are two kinds of morality:🔽worldly and transcendent.🔽The worldly is further divided into two kinds:

original: de la lhan cig skyes pa ni bcos ma ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: de la lhan cig skyes pa ni bcos ma ma byas pa'o //
translated: innate and cultivated.🔽The innate is that which is not contrived.

original: 'du ba ni bcos ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'du ba ni bcos ma byas pa'o //
translated: The cultivated is that which is contrived.

original: yang tshul khrims rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang tshul khrims rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There is another twofold division of morality:🔽the morality of the householder and the morality of the renunciate.

original: khyim na gnas pa'i spyod pa dang / khyim na mi gnas pa'i spyod pa'o; ;de la khyim na gnas pa'i spyod pa ni bslab pa'i gzhi lnga'o //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa'i spyod pa dang / khyim na mi gnas pa'i spyod pa'o; ;de la khyim na gnas pa'i spyod pa ni bslab pa'i gzhi lnga'o //
translated: The morality of the householder consists of the five precepts.

original: khyim na mi gnas pa'i spyod pa ni bslab pa'i gzhi so so thar pas rab tu byung ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: khyim na mi gnas pa'i spyod pa ni bslab pa'i gzhi so so thar pas rab tu byung ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: The morality of the renunciate consists of the precepts of the Prātimokṣa.

original: yang tshul khrims rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang tshul khrims rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There is another twofold division of morality:

original: sna gcig spyod pa dang / du ma spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sna gcig spyod pa dang / du ma spyod pa'o //
translated: The one who practices partially and the one who practices fully.

original: de la sna gcig spyod pa ni bslab pa'i gzhi gcig 'dzin pa'o //🔽du ma spyod pa ni gnyis sam /
analyzed: de la sna gcig spyod pa ni bslab pa'i gzhi gcig 'dzin pa'o // du ma spyod pa ni gnyis sam /
translated: The one who practices partially is the one who takes up one part of the precepts.

original: gsum 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gsum 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The one who practices fully is the one who takes up two or three parts.

original: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Again, there are two kinds:

original: skye mched dang / skye mched ma yin no //
analyzed: skye mched dang / skye mched ma yin no //
translated: the one who is a basis and the one who is not a basis.

original: de la skye mched ni tshe rabs thams cad du bslab pa'i gzhi 'dzin pa'o //🔽skye mched ma yin pa ni 'di ltar sems kyi khyad par gyis sam /
analyzed: de la skye mched ni tshe rabs thams cad du bslab pa'i gzhi 'dzin pa'o // skye mched ma yin pa ni 'di ltar sems kyi khyad par gyis sam /
translated: The one who is a basis is the one who takes up the precepts in all lives.

original: spro ba'i khyad par gyis bslab pa'i gzhi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: spro ba'i khyad par gyis bslab pa'i gzhi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The one who is not a basis is the one who takes up the precepts by the difference of mind or by the difference of enthusiasm.

original: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Again, there are two kinds:

original: rnyog pa dang bcas pa dang / rnyog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnyog pa dang bcas pa dang / rnyog pa med pa'o //
translated: the one with defilement and the one without defilement.

original: de la rnyog pa dang bcas pa ni mtho ris su skye bar 'dod pa'i sems so //
analyzed: de la rnyog pa dang bcas pa ni mtho ris su skye bar 'dod pa'i sems so //
translated: The one with defilement is the one whose mind desires to be born in the higher realms.

original: rnyog pa med pa ni mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gro bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: rnyog pa med pa ni mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gro bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: The one without defilement is the one who desires to go to nirvana.

original: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Again, there are two kinds:

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: the mundane and the supramundane.

original: @162b de la 'jig rten pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: @162b de la 'jig rten pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The mundane is that which is contaminated.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni zag pa med pa'o //
translated: The supramundane is that which is uncontaminated.

original: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Again, there is a twofold classification:

original: bdag 'dzin pa dang / gzhan 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag 'dzin pa dang / gzhan 'dzin pa'o //
translated: that which is held by oneself and that which is held by others.

original: de la bdag 'dzin pa ni bdag nyid kyis tshul khrims 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de la bdag 'dzin pa ni bdag nyid kyis tshul khrims 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Of these, that which is held by oneself is the moral discipline that one holds by oneself.

original: gzhan 'dzin pa ni gzhan yang rigs pa'i tshul khrims la 'jog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan 'dzin pa ni gzhan yang rigs pa'i tshul khrims la 'jog par byed pa'o //
translated: That which is held by others is the moral discipline that one causes others to hold.

original: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Again, there is a twofold classification:

original: 'jug pa dang / ldog pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang / ldog pa'o //
translated: that which is engaged and that which is disengaged.

original: de la 'jug pa ni 'khor bar 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa ni 'khor bar 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: Of these, that which is engaged is that which causes one to enter into the life-cycle.

original: ldog pa ni ye shes kyi rgyu ste /
analyzed: ldog pa ni ye shes kyi rgyu ste /
translated: That which is disengaged is the cause of intuition,

original: mi slob pa'i ye shes la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i ye shes la dmigs pa'o //
translated: for it is the objective support of the intuition of one beyond training.

original: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Again, there is a twofold classification:

original: ye shes dang ldan pa dang / sbyin pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes dang ldan pa dang / sbyin pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: that which is endowed with intuition and that which is endowed with generosity.

original: de la sbyin pa dang ldan pa ni longs spyod chen po thob pa'o //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa dang ldan pa ni longs spyod chen po thob pa'o //
translated: Of these, that which is endowed with generosity is the attainment of great resources.

original: ye shes dang ldan pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes dang ldan pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'o //
translated: That which is endowed with intuition is the attainment of liberation.

original: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Again, there is a twofold classification:

original: phyi rol tu spyod pa 'jug pa dang; nang du spyod pa 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol tu spyod pa 'jug pa dang; nang du spyod pa 'jug pa'o //
translated: The first is external conduct, and the second is internal conduct.

original: de la phyi rol tu spyod pa 'jug pa ni lus la mi rten pa'o //
analyzed: de la phyi rol tu spyod pa 'jug pa ni lus la mi rten pa'o //
translated: External conduct is not based on the body.

original: nang du spyod pa 'jug pa ni sems rab tu dad pas byas pa'i sems dang / ngag go /
analyzed: nang du spyod pa 'jug pa ni sems rab tu dad pas byas pa'i sems dang / ngag go /
translated: Internal conduct is the mind and speech that are produced by a mind of faith.

original: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two more kinds of conduct:

original: goms pa dang / ma goms pa'o //
analyzed: goms pa dang / ma goms pa'o //
translated: that which is cultivated and that which is not cultivated.

original: de la goms pa ni tshe rabs du ma dag tu goms pa'o //
analyzed: de la goms pa ni tshe rabs du ma dag tu goms pa'o //
translated: That which is cultivated is cultivated over many lifetimes.

original: ma goms pa ni tshe gcig tu goms pa ste /
analyzed: ma goms pa ni tshe gcig tu goms pa ste /
translated: That which is not cultivated is cultivated in a single lifetime.

original: de ltar dge slong de rnam pa du mas tshul khrims rnam pa gnyis gnyis la dpyod par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar dge slong de rnam pa du mas tshul khrims rnam pa gnyis gnyis la dpyod par byed do //
translated: In this way, the monk analyzes the two kinds of morality in many ways.

original: de nas yang dge slong de shin tu zhib por tshul khrims rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed de /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong de shin tu zhib por tshul khrims rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed de /
translated: “ ‘The monk then analyzes morality in great detail:

original: tshul khrims sna tshogs du yod /🔽rnam @163a *// pa du yod snyam nas des brtags na /
analyzed: tshul khrims sna tshogs du yod / rnam @163a *// pa du yod snyam nas des brtags na /
translated: “How many kinds of morality are there?🔽What are their aspects?”

original: tshul khrims rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: He examines this and finds that there are three kinds of morality:

original: phyogs gcig pa dang / phyogs gcig pa ma yin pa dang / mtho ris su 'gro ba'o; ;de la phyogs gcig pa ni bslab pa'i gzhi gcig 'dzin pa'o //🔽phyogs gcig pa ma yin pa ni bslab pa'i gzhi gnyis sam /
analyzed: phyogs gcig pa dang / phyogs gcig pa ma yin pa dang / mtho ris su 'gro ba'o; ;de la phyogs gcig pa ni bslab pa'i gzhi gcig 'dzin pa'o // phyogs gcig pa ma yin pa ni bslab pa'i gzhi gnyis sam /
translated: The one-sided is the one that observes one part of the precepts.

original: gsum 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gsum 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The non-one-sided is the one that observes two or three parts.

original: mtho ris su 'gro ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi tshogs par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mtho ris su 'gro ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi tshogs par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The one that leads to heaven is the one that observes the complete set of precepts.

original: yang rna pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang rna pa gsum ste /
translated: There is also a threefold classification:

original: nor la sred par byas pa dang / nor la sred par ma byas pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: nor la sred par byas pa dang / nor la sred par ma byas pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: that which is made to crave wealth, that which is not made to crave wealth, and that which is innate.

original: de la nor la sred par byas pa ni stobs 'gyed pas 'tsho ba'o //
analyzed: de la nor la sred par byas pa ni stobs 'gyed pas 'tsho ba'o //
translated: That which is made to crave wealth is the livelihood of those who make a living by fighting.

original: nor la sred par ma byas pa ni nad bu can rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: nor la sred par ma byas pa ni nad bu can rnams kyi'o //
translated: That which is not made to crave wealth is that of the sick.

original: lhan cig skyes pa ni mya ngan chen pos thebs pa yin te 'di ni chung ngo //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa ni mya ngan chen pos thebs pa yin te 'di ni chung ngo //
translated: That which is innate is that of those who are struck by great sorrow. This is the lesser.

original: yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There is also a threefold classification:

original: bsam gtan dang lhan cig spyod pa dang / bsam gtan ma yin pa dang lhan cig spyod pa dang / langs nas lhan cig spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang lhan cig spyod pa dang / bsam gtan ma yin pa dang lhan cig spyod pa dang / langs nas lhan cig spyod pa'o //
translated: 1. the one who practices together with meditation, 2. the one who practices without meditation, and 3. the one who practices after rising from meditation.

original: de la bsam gtan dang lhan cig spyod pa ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyi rkyen med pa'i bar gyis 'dod chags la sogs pa skyed par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang lhan cig spyod pa ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyi rkyen med pa'i bar gyis 'dod chags la sogs pa skyed par mi byed pa'o //
translated: The one who practices together with meditation is the one who, even without the conditions for the arising of desire, etc., does not generate desire, etc.

original: bsam gtan ma yin pa dang lhan cig spyod pa ni phyi rol pa rnams kyi bsam gtan med kyang de ltar tshul khrims su 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan ma yin pa dang lhan cig spyod pa ni phyi rol pa rnams kyi bsam gtan med kyang de ltar tshul khrims su 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The one who practices without meditation is the one who, even without meditation, is still moral, as in the case of the non-Buddhist.

original: langs nas lhan cig spyod pa ni skyon gang dmigs nas de dag des yongs su spong bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: langs nas lhan cig spyod pa ni skyon gang dmigs nas de dag des yongs su spong bar byed pa yin te /
translated: The one who practices after rising from meditation is the one who, having observed a fault, abandons it by means of that meditation.

original: ji ltar chang @163b gis myos nas mi gtsang ba kun tu spyod do //
analyzed: ji ltar chang @163b gis myos nas mi gtsang ba kun tu spyod do //
translated: For example, a person, having become intoxicated with alcohol, engages in impure conduct.

original: des chang de so sor gcod par byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: des chang de so sor gcod par byed pa bzhin no //
translated: He abandons that alcohol.

original: yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, there are three kinds of moral discipline:

original: ngan g-yo byed pas srung ba dang / ngan g-yo byed pa ma yin pas srung pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: ngan g-yo byed pas srung ba dang / ngan g-yo byed pa ma yin pas srung pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: 1) guarded by deceit, 2) guarded by non-deceit, and 3) innate.

original: de la ngan g-yo byed pas srung ba ni nyon mongs shing 'bras bu chung ba'o //
analyzed: de la ngan g-yo byed pas srung ba ni nyon mongs shing 'bras bu chung ba'o //
translated: Among them, guarded by deceit is afflicted and has small fruit.

original: ngan g-yo byed pa ma yin pas srung ba ni 'bras bu che ba'o //
analyzed: ngan g-yo byed pa ma yin pas srung ba ni 'bras bu che ba'o //
translated: Guarded by non-deceit has great fruit.

original: lhan cig skyes pa ni sems las byung ba'i bye brag gis 'bras bu che ba'am /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa ni sems las byung ba'i bye brag gis 'bras bu che ba'am /
translated: Innately means that by the distinction of mental factors, it has great fruit or

original: 'bras bu chung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu chung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: small fruit.

original: yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Again, there are three types:

original: rkyen gyis 'dzin pa dang / rkyen med pas 'dzin pa dang / bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen gyis 'dzin pa dang / rkyen med pas 'dzin pa dang / bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: 1) guarded by conditions, 2) guarded by non-conditions, and 3) not to be done.

original: de la rkyen gyis 'dzin pa ni bslab pa'i gzhi tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa de rkyen rnyed nas srung ba yin te /
analyzed: de la rkyen gyis 'dzin pa ni bslab pa'i gzhi tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa de rkyen rnyed nas srung ba yin te /
translated: Among them, guarded by conditions is the basis of training, the morality that is taken up, guarded when the conditions are obtained,

original: bslab pa'i gzhi bsdus nas 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi bsdus nas 'dzin pa'o //
translated: and guarded by collecting the basis of training.

original: rkyen med pas 'dzin pa ni gang rkyen med pa des srung ba'o //
analyzed: rkyen med pas 'dzin pa ni gang rkyen med pa des srung ba'o //
translated: Guarded by non-conditions is that guarded by what is not a condition.

original: bya ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rigs chen por skyes pa rnams kyi bya ba ma yin pa sdig pa mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rigs chen por skyes pa rnams kyi bya ba ma yin pa sdig pa mi byed pa'o //
translated: “Non-action” means not doing evil, which is not the action of those born into the great family.

original: de la rkyen gyis 'dzin pa ni sems las byung ba'i bye brag gis 'dzin te 'bras bu che ba yin no //
analyzed: de la rkyen gyis 'dzin pa ni sems las byung ba'i bye brag gis 'dzin te 'bras bu che ba yin no //
translated: Among them, “grasped by conditions” is grasped by a specific mental factor, and has great results.

original: rkyen med pas 'dzin pa ni de rnam par ma shes te 'bras bu chung ba yin no //
analyzed: rkyen med pas 'dzin pa ni de rnam par ma shes te 'bras bu chung ba yin no //
translated: “Not grasped by conditions” is not cognized, and has small results.

original: bya ba ma yin pas byas pa ni 'jig rten 'dir legs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: bya ba ma yin pas byas pa ni 'jig rten 'dir legs par byed pa yin te /
translated: “Done by non-action” is good in this world,

original: 'bras bu che ba'am /
analyzed: 'bras bu che ba'am /
translated: and has great results.

original: slar chung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slar chung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Or it becomes small again.

original: yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Again, there are three types:

original: bla mas 'jigs pa dang / bla ma ma yin pas 'jigs pa @164a *//
analyzed: bla mas 'jigs pa dang / bla ma ma yin pas 'jigs pa @164a *//
translated: fear of superiors, fear of non-superiors,

original: dang; ngan song du 'gro bas 'jigs pa'o //🔽de la gang bla mas 'jigs nas tshul khrims len pa de ni chung ba yin no //
analyzed: dang; ngan song du 'gro bas 'jigs pa'o // de la gang bla mas 'jigs nas tshul khrims len pa de ni chung ba yin no //
translated: and fear of going to the lower realms.🔽Among them, those who take up morality out of fear of superiors have small [morality].

original: gang bla ma ma yin pas 'jigs nas len pa de ni 'bring yin no //
analyzed: gang bla ma ma yin pas 'jigs nas len pa de ni 'bring yin no //
translated: Those who take it up out of fear of non-superiors have medium [morality].

original: gang ngan song du 'gro bas 'jigs nas len pa de ni chen po yin no //
analyzed: gang ngan song du 'gro bas 'jigs nas len pa de ni chen po yin no //
translated: The great one is that which is taken up by one who is afraid of going to the unfortunate planes of existence.

original: yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, there is a threefold morality:

original: bdag nyid tshul khrims dang ldan par byed pa dang / gzhan tshul khrims la 'jog par byed pa dang / gzhan la btang snyoms su gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid tshul khrims dang ldan par byed pa dang / gzhan tshul khrims la 'jog par byed pa dang / gzhan la btang snyoms su gnas pa'o //
translated: the morality of the bodhisattva who is engaged in his own aim; the morality of the bodhisattva who is engaged in the aim of others; and the morality of the bodhisattva who is engaged in his own and others' aims.

original: yang tshul khrims rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang tshul khrims rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, there is a threefold morality:

original: gags dang bcas pa dang / gags med pa dang / gags thams cad pa'o //🔽de la gags dang bcas pa ni gang sngon tshul khrims dang ldan la /
analyzed: gags dang bcas pa dang / gags med pa dang / gags thams cad pa'o // de la gags dang bcas pa ni gang sngon tshul khrims dang ldan la /
translated: the morality which is obstructed; the morality which is unobstructed; and the morality which is obstructed and unobstructed.

original: phyis tshul khrims 'chal pa yin te /
analyzed: phyis tshul khrims 'chal pa yin te /
translated: The morality which is obstructed is that of one who was previously moral but later becomes immoral.

original: gags dang bcas pa'i tshul khrims ni de yin no //
analyzed: gags dang bcas pa'i tshul khrims ni de yin no //
translated: The morality which is obstructed is that of one who is immoral.

original: gags med pa ni rtag par tshe rabs su thog ma dang / bar dang / tha ma'i mthar tshul khrims dang ldan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gags med pa ni rtag par tshe rabs su thog ma dang / bar dang / tha ma'i mthar tshul khrims dang ldan pa nyid yin no //
translated: The morality which is unobstructed is that of one who is always moral in all lives, in the beginning, middle, and end.

original: gags thams cad pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba log pas srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i mchod sbyin byed pa'i tshul khrims yin no //
analyzed: gags thams cad pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba log pas srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i mchod sbyin byed pa'i tshul khrims yin no //
translated: The so-called “obstruction of all” is the morality of those who, due to wrong views, make offerings and sacrifices such as killing.

original: de nas yang dge slong de tshul khrims rnam pa bzhi rnam par 'byed cing rtog par byed de /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong de tshul khrims rnam pa bzhi rnam par 'byed cing rtog par byed de /
translated: Then, the monk further analyzes and investigates the four kinds of morality.

original: ngag gi rdzun dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa ste /
analyzed: ngag gi rdzun dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa ste /
translated: Speech is false, slanderous, harsh, and frivolous.

original: de dag dang 'bral bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag dang 'bral bar byed do //
translated: One should be free from these.

original: yang tshul khrims rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: yang tshul khrims rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five kinds of morality:

original: yul lnga spangs pas bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: yul lnga spangs pas bskyed pa'o //
translated: generated by abandoning the five objects.

original: yang tshul khrims rnam @164b pa drug ste /
analyzed: yang tshul khrims rnam @164b pa drug ste /
translated: There are six kinds of morality:

original: bar chad byed pa dang / bar chad byed pa med pa dang / rgyal po'i chad pas 'jigs nas blangs pa dang / 'brel pas blangs pa dang / rtog pa med pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: bar chad byed pa dang / bar chad byed pa med pa dang / rgyal po'i chad pas 'jigs nas blangs pa dang / 'brel pas blangs pa dang / rtog pa med pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: that which is obstructed, that which is unobstructed, that which is taken up out of fear of royal punishment, that which is taken up out of connection, that which is non-conceptual, and that which is innate.

original: yang tshul khrims rnam pa bdun ste /
analyzed: yang tshul khrims rnam pa bdun ste /
translated: There are seven kinds of morality:

original: lus dang / ngag gi'o //
analyzed: lus dang / ngag gi'o //
translated: that of body and speech.

original: de ltar dge slong de tshul khrims rnam pa du ma la rab tu spyod par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar dge slong de tshul khrims rnam pa du ma la rab tu spyod par byed de /
translated: In this way, the monk practices in many ways in terms of discipline.

original: gang gis sems can rnams ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa las grol bar byed pa de ni mdor na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gang gis sems can rnams ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa las grol bar byed pa de ni mdor na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In brief, there are two ways in which beings are freed from the terrors of the lower realms:

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa yin no snyam mo ////
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa yin no snyam mo ////
translated: mundane and supramundane.

original: 'phags pa dam pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa dam pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa /
translated: The Noble Dhāraṇī of the Application of Mindfulness of the True Dharma

original: bam po sum cu pa /
analyzed: bam po sum cu pa /
translated: Chapter Thirty

original: de nas rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams mthong nas /
analyzed: de nas rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams mthong nas /

translated: In this way, they contemplate the positive actions of the gods.

original: sgra dang / rig pa dang / ro dang / rnam par smin @165b pa 'de ba skyed pa rnams kyis gang du skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /

translated: “What are the actions that gods have created and accumulated that give rise to happy rebirths, and that yield the ripening of desirable, attractive, and delightful results? What are the actions that yield the ripening of happiness, that bring together all beings, and that give rise to delightful sounds, knowledge, tastes, and ripening? Where are such actions born?”

original: ya mtshan can gyi mthong ba dang thos pa kun nas 'dogs pa gzhan ma yin pa sangs rgyas kyi bstan pas lha rnams kyi skye ba dga' zhing bde bar gnas pa dpe med pa dag mthong ste /

translated: With knowledge derived from hearing, they will then examine this and see that the gods’ birth in the teachings of the Buddha is not a birth that is based on the views and claims of extremists. Instead, it is a birth that is delightful and happy, and that is beyond compare.

original: lha'i 'dun sa chos bzang gang du lha'i rgyal po koo shi kas chos dang mthun par skyong ngo //

original: phyi rol gyi 'du shes rnyed pas lha rnams kyi gnas pa dang por byas nas /🔽de ltar sa kun gyi ris rnam par 'byed par byed de /

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na gang tshul khrims rnam pa bdun bsrungs te; de ma nyams pa dang / ma ral ba dang / ma zhig pa dang / dam zhing gzhan dang mi 'dra bar rab tu spyod la /

analyzed: de ltar padma de dag gi kha dog 'dres pa yin no //

analyzed: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin gyi padma'i 'dab ma brgya pa dang / la la ni 'dab ma nyi sa brgya pa /

analyzed: la la 'dab ma bzhi brgya pa /

analyzed: la la 'dab ma lnga brgya pa /

analyzed: la la 'dab ma drug brgya pa /

original: la la 'dab ma bdun brgya pa /
analyzed: la la 'dab ma bdun brgya pa /

translated: some have eight hundred petals,🔽some have nine hundred petals,

analyzed: la la 'dab ma stong yod de /

original: kha dog sna tshogs dang / kha dog gcig ba dang / rgyu ba dang / mi rgyu ba dag brgya byin gyi gnas lha'i mdun sa chos bzang du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kha dog sna tshogs dang / kha dog gcig ba dang / rgyu ba dang / mi rgyu ba dag brgya byin gyi gnas lha'i mdun sa chos bzang du 'byung ngo //
translated: With various colors, some are moving and some are not moving, they appear in Śakra's realm, the divine assembly hall Sudharmā.

original: yang padma'i nang de dag nyid du lha'i bya 'jug pa dang / gsab gseb gyi nang na gnas pa rnams kyis kun tu gang ba ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang padma'i nang de dag nyid du lha'i bya 'jug pa dang / gsab gseb gyi nang na gnas pa rnams kyis kun tu gang ba ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: In the middle of the lotus flowers are divine birds and in the groves are many other birds.

original: gang dus tshig thams cad du rgyags pa /
analyzed: gang dus tshig thams cad du rgyags pa /
translated: They are all intoxicated and

original: 'gram pa rdul cing rol mo'i sgras rtag tu gar byed pa dag yin te /
analyzed: 'gram pa rdul cing rol mo'i sgras rtag tu gar byed pa dag yin te /
translated: their cheeks are covered with dust. They constantly dance to the sound of music.

original: de dag gang gi tshe brgya byin rdzing de dag tu lha mo'i tshogs kyis lhan cig yongs su bskor nas rtse ba de'i tshe bya de dag de bzhin dga' bar byed de /

translated: When Śakra is in the ponds, surrounded by a retinue of goddesses, the birds will also play in the same way.

analyzed: ji ltar yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i sil snyan gyi sgra de bzhin du bya de dag kyang sgra 'byin la /
translated: Just as the music of the five types of instruments sounds, so do the birds sing.

original: rgyags pas myos pa zhes bya ba'i bya rab tu gar byed pa dag byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyags pas myos pa zhes bya ba'i bya rab tu gar byed pa dag byung ngo //
translated: The birds known as intoxicated dancers will also appear.

original: gang gi tshe brgya byin gang rdzing de dag tu dga' bar byed pa de'i tshe @167b de dag kyang de bzhin du gar byed de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe brgya byin gang rdzing de dag tu dga' bar byed pa de'i tshe @167b de dag kyang de bzhin du gar byed de /
translated: When Śakra is in the ponds, they will also dance in the same way.

original: ji ltar lha mo dang / byed pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar lha mo dang / byed pa de bzhin no //
translated: It is like a goddess or a bird.

original: bya khor yug ces bya ba gser gyi mdog can me tog gi phreng ba mchu la 'phyang ba dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: bya khor yug ces bya ba gser gyi mdog can me tog gi phreng ba mchu la 'phyang ba dag 'byung ste /

analyzed: gang rdzing de dag gi 'gram gyi nang phan tshun kun nas rdzing de dag tu gnas nas gar byed cing sgra 'byin par byed de /
translated: They live in the ponds and dance and sing in the ponds.

original: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin gyi rdzing ni de lta bu yin par mthong ngo //
analyzed: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin gyi rdzing ni de lta bu yin par mthong ngo //
translated: This is what the ponds of Śakra, lord of the gods, are like.

original: de nas yang dge slong de brgya byin gyi lha'i mdun sa chos bzang legs par byas pa'i las kyis sprul pa la rtog par byed de /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong de brgya byin gyi lha'i mdun sa chos bzang legs par byas pa'i las kyis sprul pa la rtog par byed de /
translated: “ ‘The monk who has created this emanation through his wholesome actions will then examine the ponds of Śakra, lord of the gods, in the Sudharmā divine hall.

original: des brtags na rdzing gi bar na gnas pa'i nya rnams kha cig ni gser gyi mdog /🔽can; kha cig ni dngul gyi mdog can /🔽kha cig gi bee d'urya'i mdog can la /
analyzed: des brtags na rdzing gi bar na gnas pa'i nya rnams kha cig ni gser gyi mdog / can; kha cig ni dngul gyi mdog can / kha cig gi bee d'urya'i mdog can la /
translated: He will see that the fish that live in the ponds between the lotus flowers are some of them golden in color,🔽some of them silver in color,🔽some of them the color of beryl,

original: 'dab ma ni padma r'a ga'i mdog /
analyzed: 'dab ma ni padma r'a ga'i mdog /
translated: some of them the color of rubies,

original: mig ni spug lta bu /
analyzed: mig ni spug lta bu /
translated: some of them the color of cat’s eyes,

original: lto ni padma'i mdog /
analyzed: lto ni padma'i mdog /
translated: some of them the color of lotuses,🔽and some of them the color of the moon.

original: kha cig gi rgya ba ni rin po che sna tshogs kyi thig le bkra ba dag gis brgyan /
analyzed: kha cig gi rgya ba ni rin po che sna tshogs kyi thig le bkra ba dag gis brgyan /

original: kha cig gi 'dab ma ni rin po che rnam pa sna bdun gyi mdog tu 'dug ste /
analyzed: kha cig gi 'dab ma ni rin po che rnam pa sna bdun gyi mdog tu 'dug ste /
translated: The petals of some lotuses are the colors of the seven precious substances.

original: padma'i rdzing de rnams su dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: padma'i rdzing de rnams su dga' bar byed do //
translated: In this way, they enjoy themselves in the lotus ponds.

original: de nas dge slong de brgya byin gyi padma'i rdzing rnam pa gzhan de dag nyid la rtog par byed de /
analyzed: de nas dge slong de brgya byin gyi padma'i rdzing rnam pa gzhan de dag nyid la rtog par byed de /
translated: “The monk will then examine the other lotus ponds of Śakra.

original: gang gis de dag gis ris nyid rnam pa du yod cig gu snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na; sa de dag gi ris kha cig dag bye ma bdal ba lta bur mu tig bkram pa /🔽kha cig dngul gyi phye ma /
analyzed: gang gis de dag gis ris nyid rnam pa du yod cig gu snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na; sa de dag gi ris kha cig dag bye ma bdal ba lta bur mu tig bkram pa / kha cig dngul gyi phye ma /
translated: ‘What are the different types of lotuses?’ With knowledge derived from hearing he will then examine the different types of lotuses. Some of the lotuses are spread with sand of pearls,🔽some with sand of silver,

original: kha cig gser gyi phye ma /
analyzed: kha cig gser gyi phye ma /
translated: some with sand of gold,

original: kha cig nor bu bee d'urya bkram ste /🔽de ltar brgya byin @168a *//
analyzed: kha cig nor bu bee d'urya bkram ste / de ltar brgya byin @168a *//
translated: and some with sand of beryl.

original: gyi lags par byas pa'i las kyi sprul pas de dag gis ris bkra ba dag mthong ngo //
analyzed: gyi lags par byas pa'i las kyi sprul pas de dag gis ris bkra ba dag mthong ngo //
translated: In this way, Śakra’s emanations of karmic actions make the lotuses appear in different colors.🔽“The monk will then examine the other lotus ponds of Śakra.

original: de nas yang dge slong de gnas de dag gi ris nyid la rtog par byed de /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong de gnas de dag gi ris nyid la rtog par byed de / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: “Next, the monk will examine the features of those realms.

original: 'di ltar rdzing de dag nyid kyi 'gram de kun nas kha cig gi kha khyer gser las byas pa dag gis yongs su bskor /🔽kha cig gi kha khyer nor bu bee d'urya /🔽kha cig ni dngul las byas /
analyzed: 'di ltar rdzing de dag nyid kyi 'gram de kun nas kha cig gi kha khyer gser las byas pa dag gis yongs su bskor / kha cig gi kha khyer nor bu bee d'urya / kha cig ni dngul las byas /
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then notice that the banks of those lotus pools are completely surrounded by golden embankments in some places,🔽embankments of beryl in others,🔽embankments of silver in others,

original: kha cig gser dag las byas la /
analyzed: kha cig gser dag las byas la /
translated: and embankments of gold in others.

original: mu tig gi dra bas kun nas bres pa yin te /
analyzed: mu tig gi dra bas kun nas bres pa yin te /
translated: The banks are covered with nets of pearls.

original: de ltar bya'i tshogs kha dog sna tshogs dga' ba'i sgra dang / 'gro ba rnams kyis padma'i rdzing gi 'gram de dag kun tu gang bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar bya'i tshogs kha dog sna tshogs dga' ba'i sgra dang / 'gro ba rnams kyis padma'i rdzing gi 'gram de dag kun tu gang bar mthong ngo //
translated: In this way, flocks of birds of various colors sing delightful songs, and the banks of the lotus pools are filled with beings.

original: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de lha'i mdun sa chos bzang la rtog par byed de /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de lha'i mdun sa chos bzang la rtog par byed de /
translated: “Next, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will examine the divine Sudharma Assembly Hall.

original: padma'i rdzing gi padma de dag gi nang na rgyu ba bung ba'i tshogs kyi mdog dang / kha dog sna tshogs /
analyzed: padma'i rdzing gi padma de dag gi nang na rgyu ba bung ba'i tshogs kyi mdog dang / kha dog sna tshogs /
translated: In the middle of the lotus ponds are various kinds of bees with various colors and hues.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽gser gyi mdog can rnams kyi nang du bung ba dngul gyi mdog can /🔽'dab ma rdo rje'i myu gu lta bur reg na bde ba dag la rgyu la /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / gser gyi mdog can rnams kyi nang du bung ba dngul gyi mdog can / 'dab ma rdo rje'i myu gu lta bur reg na bde ba dag la rgyu la /
translated: The bees are of the following colors:🔽In the golden lotuses are bees with silver bodies and wings like vajra sprouts that are pleasant to the touch.

original: dngul gyi padma rnams kyi nang du bung ba gser gyi mdog can dag rgyu ste /
analyzed: dngul gyi padma rnams kyi nang du bung ba gser gyi mdog can dag rgyu ste /
translated: In the silver lotuses are bees with golden bodies and wings like vajra sprouts that are pleasant to the touch.

original: de ltar sna tshogs dag padma sna tshogs rnams kyi nang na rgyu'o //
analyzed: de ltar sna tshogs dag padma sna tshogs rnams kyi nang na rgyu'o //
translated: Thus, in the various lotuses are various bees.

original: de ltar las dge bas 'bras bu sna tshogs dag 'byung bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar las dge bas 'bras bu sna tshogs dag 'byung bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
translated: In this way, the monk sees that virtuous actions give rise to various results.

original: de nas yang dge slong de lha'i mdun sa @168b chos bzang de nyid la thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas rtog cing de'i tshal dag la'ang rab tu dpyod par byed de /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong de lha'i mdun sa @168b chos bzang de nyid la thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas rtog cing de'i tshal dag la'ang rab tu dpyod par byed de /
translated: “ ‘With knowledge derived from hearing, the monk will then examine the divine Dharma court of Sudharma and analyze the forests there.

original: lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyi tshal dag rnam pa du yod snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyi tshal dag rnam pa du yod snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: What are the features of the groves of Śakra, lord of the gods?

original: 'di ltar lha'i mdun sa chos bzang dag na tshal yod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar lha'i mdun sa chos bzang dag na tshal yod la /
translated: When he examines this with knowledge derived from hearing, he will see that there are groves in the divine assembly hall of Sudharmā.

original: de ltar tshal de re re la rab tu dpyod par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar tshal de re re la rab tu dpyod par byed de /
translated: He will examine each of these groves.

original: de'i tshal bud med dga' ba zhes bya ba dang / kun dga' zhes bya ba dang / dpe med pa zhes bya ba dang / bkra ba zhes bya ba tshal bzhi po de dag ni lha'i mdun sa chos bzang dag na yod do //
analyzed: de'i tshal bud med dga' ba zhes bya ba dang / kun dga' zhes bya ba dang / dpe med pa zhes bya ba dang / bkra ba zhes bya ba tshal bzhi po de dag ni lha'i mdun sa chos bzang dag na yod do //
translated: There are four groves in the divine assembly hall of Sudharmā: the grove called Delight of Women, the grove called Joy, the grove called Incomparable, and the grove called Colorful.

original: de ltar de tshal re re dag la rab tu spyod par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar de tshal re re dag la rab tu spyod par byed de /
translated: He will examine each of these groves.

original: tshal gang du lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor cing /
analyzed: tshal gang du lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor cing /
translated: In the grove where Śakra, lord of the gods, is surrounded by a retinue of goddesses,

original: lha'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa rnams kyis dga' zhing mgu la rtse zhing yongs su spyod pa'i tshal ni gang yin /
analyzed: lha'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa rnams kyis dga' zhing mgu la rtse zhing yongs su spyod pa'i tshal ni gang yin /
translated: What are the divine groves where the gods enjoy themselves, delighting in the five divine sense pleasures of form, sound, smell, taste, and touch?

original: dga' bar spyod pa'i rnam pa ni du zhig yod cig gu snyam nas /
analyzed: dga' bar spyod pa'i rnam pa ni du zhig yod cig gu snyam nas /
translated: How many kinds of enjoyment are there?

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing, he will then notice

original: bud med dga' ba zhes bya ba'i tshal yod de /
analyzed: bud med dga' ba zhes bya ba'i tshal yod de /
translated: the grove called Delightful Women.

original: tshal de ni lha'i shing ljon pa dang / me tog dang / 'bras bus ni brgyan /
analyzed: tshal de ni lha'i shing ljon pa dang / me tog dang / 'bras bus ni brgyan /
translated: This grove is adorned with divine trees, flowers, and fruits.

original: bya'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor /
analyzed: bya'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor /
translated: It is surrounded by flocks of birds.

original: shing de dpag bsam gyi shing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shing de dpag bsam gyi shing zhes bya ba la /
translated: The trees are called wish-fulfilling trees.

original: de ltar de dag ni ji ltar 'dod pa zhes bya bar 'gyur te /🔽gang sum cu rtsa gsum dag yid la @169a *//
analyzed: de ltar de dag ni ji ltar 'dod pa zhes bya bar 'gyur te / gang sum cu rtsa gsum dag yid la @169a *//
translated: In this way, the gods can obtain whatever they wish for.

original: sems par byed pa de tshal de dag las rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems par byed pa de tshal de dag las rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three think of, they will find in this grove.

original: de dag gang gi tshe rtse ba'i phyir tshal der nye bar 'gro bar byed na de'i tshe shing ljon pa de dag gi me tog shin tu bzang po rab tu rgyas shing me tog kha phye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gang gi tshe rtse ba'i phyir tshal der nye bar 'gro bar byed na de'i tshe shing ljon pa de dag gi me tog shin tu bzang po rab tu rgyas shing me tog kha phye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When they go to the forest to play, the flowers of the trees open and bloom.

original: gang gi tshe bud med dag tshal de dag gi nang du zhugs la shing ljon pa'i drung du nye bar song ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bud med dag tshal de dag gi nang du zhugs la shing ljon pa'i drung du nye bar song ste /
translated: When the women enter the forest and approach the trees,

original: shing ljon pa dag las me tog rnams len par 'dod pa de'i tshe ji ltar bud med kyis slebs tsam du shing ljon pa de dag 'phyang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing ljon pa dag las me tog rnams len par 'dod pa de'i tshe ji ltar bud med kyis slebs tsam du shing ljon pa de dag 'phyang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the trees bend down so that the women can pick the flowers.

original: yang de ltar me tog gi rnam pa de dag blangs pa dang / me tog gi rnam pa gzhan dang / kha dog gzhan dang / dri gzhan dang / dbyibs gzhan dang / rnam pa gzhan dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang de ltar me tog gi rnam pa de dag blangs pa dang / me tog gi rnam pa gzhan dang / kha dog gzhan dang / dri gzhan dang / dbyibs gzhan dang / rnam pa gzhan dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: When the flowers are picked, other flowers of different colors, scents, shapes, and forms appear.

original: lha mo de dag gis ji ltar bsams pa bzhin dpag bsam gyi shing de dag gi don du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha mo de dag gis ji ltar bsams pa bzhin dpag bsam gyi shing de dag gi don du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The wish-fulfilling trees provide whatever the goddesses desire.

original: yang dpag bsam gyi shing de dag rnam pa gzhan du ston te /
analyzed: yang dpag bsam gyi shing de dag rnam pa gzhan du ston te /
translated: Moreover, those wish-fulfilling trees manifest in other ways.

original: rol mo'i sgra'i rnam pa thos na nyams dga' ba rnam pa lnga'i bar dag 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: rol mo'i sgra'i rnam pa thos na nyams dga' ba rnam pa lnga'i bar dag 'byung ba ni /
translated: When the sound of music is heard, up to five types of delightful sounds occur.

original: rgyud can dang / rnga dang / sil dkrol dang / gling bu dang / sgra snyan pa dag lha mo de dag gi yid kyis bsams shing /
analyzed: rgyud can dang / rnga dang / sil dkrol dang / gling bu dang / sgra snyan pa dag lha mo de dag gi yid kyis bsams shing /
translated: The sound of strings, drums, percussion, flutes, and melodious sounds arise from the minds of those goddesses.

original: de bzhin du dbyangs kyi rnam pa mnyan par bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbyangs kyi rnam pa mnyan par bya'o snyam mo //
translated: Likewise, one should listen to the types of melodies.

original: de nas sems bskyed ma thag tu shing ljon pa'i lo ma rnams kyi nang du dge ba'i las kyis skyed pa'i @169b rlung de dag rab tu ldang ngo //
analyzed: de nas sems bskyed ma thag tu shing ljon pa'i lo ma rnams kyi nang du dge ba'i las kyis skyed pa'i @169b rlung de dag rab tu ldang ngo //
translated: Then, as soon as the thought arises, the winds that are produced by virtuous karma stir within the leaves of the trees.

original: rlung gang gis lo ma de dag la de bzhin phog pa dang / de ltar rnam pa ji snyed yod pa'i lo ma de dag rnam pa de snyed du de ltar sgra 'byin par byed de /
analyzed: rlung gang gis lo ma de dag la de bzhin phog pa dang / de ltar rnam pa ji snyed yod pa'i lo ma de dag rnam pa de snyed du de ltar sgra 'byin par byed de /
translated: The winds that touch the leaves in that way cause the leaves to emit sounds in that way, in whatever types of ways there are.

original: ji ltar yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i sil snyan chags par 'os pa'i rgyud can dang / rnga dang / sil dkrol dang / gling bu dang / sgra snyan pa'i rnam pa de dag lo ma de dag las 'byung ste /
analyzed: ji ltar yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i sil snyan chags par 'os pa'i rgyud can dang / rnga dang / sil dkrol dang / gling bu dang / sgra snyan pa'i rnam pa de dag lo ma de dag las 'byung ste /
translated: Just as from the leaves of the wish-fulfilling tree there emerges the sound of the five types of musical instruments such as the lute, the drum, the flute, the conch, and the pleasant sound of song.

original: de bas na dpag bsam gyi shing zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dpag bsam gyi shing zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the wish-fulfilling tree.

original: yang dpag bsam kyi shing rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dpag bsam kyi shing rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, the wish-fulfilling tree changes in other ways.🔽Just as for the gods in the Heaven of the Thirty-three, the wish-fulfilling tree fulfills the wishes of the gods in the Heaven Free from Strife.

original: ji ltar lha mo 'dod 'gro dag sems dang mthun pa'i rgyun dang / gos dang / 'bras bu'i rnam pa ji lta ba bzhin lha mo'i yid la 'dod na /
analyzed: ji ltar lha mo 'dod 'gro dag sems dang mthun pa'i rgyun dang / gos dang / 'bras bu'i rnam pa ji lta ba bzhin lha mo'i yid la 'dod na /
